1.content:
Salon-the-Job Training: When a young man gets a job sweeping up at a salon, his co-workers decide to teach him about the various treatments they do there.

Spell-ing Error: Two friends get more than they bargained for when they try to conjure up a woman with a stolen spell book.

New You: A young man who is depressed with his station in life finds an ad for self-help tapes that promise to completely change his life.
1.title: Beginnings

choices: Rosie offers to teach Alex how to do manicures
Camille offers to teach Alex how to cut/style hair
Emilia offers Alex some fashion advice
11.content:
Alex ended up working in a salon practically by accident. See, he had been applying for jobs at several local places, in order to contribute to his upcoming college tuition in the fall, and in the high volume, he sent a few out to places he barely glanced it, just to put feelers out. He had assumed that Chez Aphrodite was a hipster bar or coffee shop. On the same token, the owner of the salon misread his resume, and based on his name, thought he was a young woman. Color them both surprised when the clearly male Alex showed up for the interview.

Despite the initial confusion, the owner, Emilia, was impressed with Alex's resume and offered him a job sweeping up hair as a start, perhaps moving him to taking payment once he was familiar with the place. As one of the only actual interviews that Alex got, he quickly accepted.

For the first few weeks, everything was going well, Alex was sweeping, the other employees, like the hair stylist, Camille, and the manicurist, Rosie, were friendly to him, getting on well. But there were a few stray comments about the "young man" and how some of the clients (mostly women) were uncomfortable with him being there. Now, because the employees liked him and didn't want to have to let him go, they started thinking of how they could make the clients more comfortable, and restore the formerly feminine atmosphere to the salon.

One day, shortly after Alex arrived, and an hour before the salon was due to open, the three women got together to decide what their first step would be.

Where do they start with Alex?
11.title: Salon-the-Job Training

111.content:
As Alex swept up some stray hair and dust near the door, the ladies set up their workstations for the day. As she placed a few bottles of nail polish down at her table, Rosie looked up and called over to Alex.

"Alex, can you come over here?" Rosie asked.

Alex leaned his broom against the wall and walked over to the nail station. Rosie beckoned for him to sit down.

"Take a seat." Rosie said.

"Something wrong?" Alex asked.

"No, but we've been thinking." Rosie replied.

"Thinking?" Alex glanced around at Emilia and Camille, who were busily setting up their own workstations.

"Yeah. We think that you should learn how to do some of the things that we do, just in case we get swamped or need another set of hands really quick." Rosie said.

"So you want to teach me how to do hair and nails and all that?" Alex asked.

"To start, yes. Maybe some of the more in depth stuff later. Would that be something you'd be interested in?" Rosie asked. "After all, it'd be a lot more work, so you could pick up more hours."

Alex thought it over in his head, on the one hand, he really had no interest in all this junk, but on the other hand, the promise of more money was tempting.

What does Alex say?
111.title: Rosie offers to teach Alex how to do manicures

choices: Alex is given his first client
1111.content:
"Why not?" Alex replied.

"Great, just set your hands down there, and I'll show you the ropes." Rosie said.

Alex hesitated and looked at Rosie with a puzzled expression.

"Wait, if you're teaching me how to do it, shouldn't I be doing your nails?"

"Usually, that would be the case. But..." Rosie grabbed Alex's hand and examined his nails. "Our clients won't be inclined to let you do their's if yours are all ragged and dirty like this."

"Makes sense, I guess." Alex placed his hands onto the table, watching Rosie as she got to work.

"First things first," Rosie lifted Alex's hands and placed them into a basin, fingers first. "This is to soften the cuticles. Though if this was a client, you'd be removing their old polish first."

Alex watched on in curiosity as Rosie showed him the ins and outs of a manicure, not something Alex ever thought he'd be interested in, but there's a lot of technique involved. It of course helped that Rosie was only a few years older than Alex and was very pretty. Rosie pulled his hands out of the basin and placed them onto the table again.

"Now, I'm going to push your cuticles back." Rosie said as she broke out a small tool and started using it on each of Alex's fingernails to push the cuticles back. "And now, it's time for the file and buff."

Rosie then took a file to the nails and began shaping them. Alex's nails weren't very long, so there wasn't much shaping apart from rounding them off at the fingertip.

"And finally..." Rosie picked up a bottle of polish.

"I'm not really sure about that." Alex started to pull his hands away.

"Nonsense, it's clear, and it's for protection. Otherwise I have to do this every day. Plus, how else will you learn? Come on." Rosie said.

Alex placed his hands back onto the table.

"There we go." Rosie uncapped the bottle and started polishing each nail.

When she was finished, she put Alex's hands under the dryer.

"Think you can handle that?" Rosie asked.

"I guess, doesn't seem all that hard." Alex said.

"That's the spirit!" Rosie exclaimed as she turned off the dryer.

Alex pulled his hands out and examined them. A little cleaner, but not obviously manicured in any way.

"Fun time's over, you two," Emilia joked as she walked up to the nail station. "We're about ready to open. Oh, and Alex, you nails look lovely. Rosie, another great job."

"That's what you pay me for!" Rosie giggled.

Alex got up from the chair and returned to his broom. Later that day...
1111.title: Alex agrees

12.content:
"Dude, we're gonna get in so much trouble!" Eric said.

"Don't worry, no one will ever know we stole your great aunt's spell book." Kyle said as he laid an old book onto the couch. "Okay, let's see what we've got."

Eric was a recent high-school graduate taking a gap year. Instead of classes, he was taking a series of odd jobs, his current one being house-sitting for his great aunt Agnes, who was on a world cruise tour for summer. Kyle was Eric's best friend, and the two, not being particularly lucky in the dating department were mostly sitting around the house bored out of their skulls.

Last week, they had been snooping around in the attic (despite explicit instruction to not go into the attic) and had uncovered a trunk of books. One of the books claimed to be a spell book. Neither of the two young men were superstitious, but Eric had remarked that Great Aunt Agnes seemingly lived an idyllic life, and with magic, that would be easy to achieve.

Today, the two were bored again, and decided to light up a joint to pass the time. In their marijuana-induced stupor, their conversation had been derailed to talking about their lack of relationships.

"Man, you know why we don't have girlfriends? Cause no girls get us, you know?" Kyle asked.

"You're right, dude." Eric agreed. "If only we could like, find a girl that gets us."

"Or..." Kyle sat forward. "What if we made one? I saw in that spell book yesterday that there was a... what was it, transfiguration spell."

"What does that mean?" Eric asked.

"It like, means to create something. And if we use it, we can create a woman, just by thinking about one." Kyle replied.

"What are we waiting for, let's do it!" Eric got up and started to rush to the attic.

By the time that they were sitting around and reading the book, Eric had sobered up somewhat, and was having second thoughts.

"Dude, we're gonna get in so much trouble!" Eric said.

"Don't worry, no one will ever know we stole your great aunt's spell book. We use it, create our woman, and put it back." Kyle said as he laid an old book onto the couch. "Okay, let's see what we've got."

Kyle opened the book and flipped through the pages.

"Let's see... create fire, create water, gain riches, see the future... aha!" Kyle exclaimed. "Transfiguration Feminam."

"Female transfiguration. You're sure that means create? Cause it looks like transform." Eric said.

"Of course it means create, if it meant transform, it'd say transform, right?" Kyle insisted.

"I guess..." Eric said.

"Okay, let's place our hands on the book and read out these words while imagining out perfect women." Kyle said.

Eric and Kyle placed their hands onto the pages as they read the words aloud.

"Spiritibus, transfiguret in me hanc femina imaginem!" the two said in unison.

When they finished, there was a flash of light and both of them were thrown back onto the ground. They stood up and tried to steady themselves as they looked around.

"Where are they?" Eric asked.

"I don't know..." Kyle replied. "They should be here."

"Guess it was a bust." Eric said.

"Guess so..." Kyle sighed.

"Hey, what's going on?" one of them exclaimed.

What happened?
12.title: Spell-ing Error

choices: Eric chooses to wear something of Great Aunt Agnes
Eric chooses to go to the mall in his current outfit
121.content:
"Maybe we missed something." Kyle ignored Eric's exclamation and started to search the pages of the book.

Eric on the other hand, felt a warmth growing inside him, along with a burbling nausea. He used his hand to wipe his face, before noticing that it seemed... smaller than it should be.

"Kyle? What exactly is your perfect woman?" Eric nervously asked as he observed his fingernails growing.

"Don't get any ideas and stealing this when we get the spell working." Kyle didn't look up from the book. "She's gotta be shorter than me, even in heels, I wouldn't want her to tower over me."

Eric noticed the room starting to grow around him.... no, he was shrinking from his typical 5' 9" to a much more compact 4'11". Eric immediately stood up and rushed over to a mirror hanging on the opposite wall. Kyle scarcely noticed and continued his summary.

"And she's gotta have nice tits, obviously. But really, I'm more of an ass man, so that has to be tight." Kyle continued.

Eric's chest began to bubble as two breasts slowly inflated around his nipples, stopping at the higher end of the B-Cup spectrum. Nearly C, but not quite. His ass also started to expand until it was straining against his, until very recently, comfortable pants.

"Kyle, stop looking at the book and look at me!" Eric demanded.

Kyle waved him off, too lost in his own world to realize the true magic that was going on in front of him.

"Long hair. Redhead. But not an unnatural shade, auburn, you know, like a reddish, brownish." Kyle continued.

Eric's hair started to grow rapidly as it expanded outward before settling onto his shoulders, with the coloring emerging from the roots and changing his formerly blonde hair into an auburn shade.

"Light voice, and she's gotta be into gaming and stuff, a nerd-girl." Kyle continued. "And her face would be pretty, cute nose, but that plain sort of pretty, the type of girl who doesn't need makeup, but probably wears it anyway."

Eric felt his face shifting, with his facial bones cracking as they restructured. As all that went on, his body slowly started to transform to match the specifics of Kyle's explanation. His body hair retracted into his body, and his male anatomy had been abruptly replaced with its female counterpart.

With no more energy left to stand, Eric collapsed to the floor, finally breaking Kyle out of his reverie.

"Eric? Dude holy shit!" Kyle leaped up and rushed over to his fallen friend.

Kyle lifted Eric up to find a pretty girl staring back at him, wrapped in clothes that were far too large for her. Like she was wearing her boyfriend's clothes.

"Eric?" Kyle asked.

"What do you think, moron?" Eric replied, before holding a dainty hand to his mouth. "Is that... oh my god."

"It worked!" Kyle exclaimed.

"No it didn't! It was supposed to create a woman, you said!" Eric stood up and waved his arms around, causing the sleeves of his hoodie to go flying every which way as he spoke.

"Well, maybe I got the translation wrong, but it did work!" Kyle insisted.

"This isn't it working, and how come it didn't work on you? Why aren't you my dream girl?" Eric demanded, hands on his hips.

"I dunno, but you gotta find some new clothes. You look ridiculous." Kyle said.

"I don't need new clothes, I need you to find the reversal spell!" Eric said.

"Yeah, but... It might take a while. Better to be comfortable, right?" Kyle asked.

"Don't give me that, you just want to see me in something that'll flatter this figure, right?" Eric asked.

"Can't blame a guy for trying." Kyle shrugged.

For hours, they pored over the book, unable to find anything about a reversal spell.

"This is hopeless!" Eric whined, moving a strand of hair out of his face repeatedly.

"I know... Nothing about reversal." Kyle said. "Maybe..."

"Maybe what?" Eric asked.

"There's that store at the mall. The weird curio store, I remember hearing back in high school that people thought the owner was a witch or something." Kyle replied.

"No way, I'm not leaving the house like this!" Eric insisted.

"What about calling your great aunt?" Kyle asked.

"That won't work either. She doesn't do technology, no phone and it's not like I can just call her cruise." Eric said.

"So that settles it. We're going to the mall."

"Go alone."

"If they can reverse it, it'll go faster with you there. Now, do you want to change, or do you want to just head out now?" Kyle asked.

Eric pondered for a moment before...
121.title: Eric starts transforming

choices: Another supernatural event occurs on the way
1211.content:
"Fine. I'll go check her closets. I suppose considering we ignored her orders not to go into the attic, I can assume she won't be too mad about borrowing clothes." Eric went up the stairs and into Agnes' room.

He went through the closet, but was unable to find anything in his current size. Eric wouldn't say that Aunt Agnes was overweight, but she certainly wasn't the size of an eighteen year old girl. And she was one of his Great Aunts who was a lifelong spinster, so she never had any kids to have kept clothing from either. After failing to find anything, he sighed and laid back onto the bed.

Just then, Kyle ran in and tossed a bundle of clothing at Eric, who started looking at the clothes now strewn about the bed.

"Any luck?" Kyle asked.

"No," Eric said, holding up a bra by its strap. "What's all this stuff?"

"Went back up to the attic. I think this is from when your aunt was our age." Kyle remarked.

Eric checked over everything, a pair of light blue panties and a matching bra, a pair of bell-bottom jeans and a 70's style white blouse.

"Dude, I can't wear this!" Eric said.

"Listen, this was as masculine as it got in there. She had a few miniskirts that I bet you'd look great in..." Kyle mused.

"Ugh, fine." Eric said. "Now, piss off while I put this stuff on."

"Okay, okay." Kyle left the room.

Eric dressed himself, taking a few moments to explore his new body. The fact that it was the literal wet dream of his best friend however, did a lot to prevent him from trying anything too experimental for the time being, worried about Kyle walking in. He hoped that Kyle wouldn't take advantage of the situation but...

Eric finished dressing, finding the clothes to fit rather well. Eric frowned in the mirror as he played with his hair a bit, wishing it wasn't as long as it was. He exited the bedroom, seeing Kyle waiting in the hall.

"Not bad. A little retro, but I admit, I like the style." Kyle grinned.

"Stow it," Eric retorted. "Did you find me a pair of shoes."

"Try these on for size." Kyle tossed a pair of platform shoes into Eric's arms.

"I am not wearing heels." Eric refused.

"That was all that was in the chest, just put them on!" Kyle shouted.

"Well... okay. If that's all there is..." Eric meekly said as he put the shoes onto his feet.

He took a few experimental steps before a fog cleared from his head.

"What the hell was that? Why did I agree to that?" Eric asked.

"That... might be me again. Part of my dream woman is a submissive personality. One who'll defer to me." Kyle replied.

"You jerk!" Eric shouted, pounding weakly on Kyle's arms.

"Listen, we're gonna fix this. I promise." Kyle grabbed Eric's shoulders. "Let's go."
1211.title: Eric chooses to wear something of Great Aunt Agnes

choices: They make it to ‘Ye Olde Magick Shoppe’ in short order.
Eric gets distracted by a mall attraction on the way there.
Eric discloses his troubled thoughts to Kyle.
12111.content:
Eric stormed his way towards the mall’s entrance, dark expression doing nothing to detract from his cuteness.

It was enough that he had to be a girl, and it was more than enough to be his friend’s fantasy girl, but Kyle didn’t have to treat him like it!

Opening the front door before him, offering his hand when leaving the car — it made him want to scream.

’He’s just trying to be nice,’ a singsong voice echoed in his head. It sounded suspiciously similar to his new one, and exactly like the one that made him put on these thrice-damned heels.

Eric ground a frustrated knuckle against his temple. It slid in between every irritated thought, every inch of anger he wanted to express towards Kyle. If he wasn’t thinking about how pissed he was, a dopey smile’d spread across his face with the idea of cuddling Kyle, or maybe even kissin— NO!

His stomps magnified their strength and speed, causing an unfortunate ripple in his backside. His face reddened over the thought of Kyle watching, though he couldn’t quite tell if it was frustration or sheepishness. This magic shit was scary.

He wrapped a dainty hand around the door handle, preparing himself for the visit inside. Make it to the witch store — where is located god-knows-where — ask the witch for help — who may or may not be a phony — and hope that she doesn’t ask for their souls in tribute. It wasn’t the best plan, but it was a plan. Kinda.

The sound of Kyle’s footsteps reached his ears, lighting a nervous fire in Eric. Maybe proximity was the x-factor in all the pink, bubbly thoughts in his head. He yanked the door to make his escape inside, away from the cloying musk of his friend… but the door didn’t budge.

He gave it a second tug, trying to brace his left foot against the other door for leverage, but he was not nearly as competent in heels as he’d like to think sending him toppling backwards…

Right into Kyle’s (warm, well muscled) arms.

Kyle blinked. “Whoa man, you gotta be careful. Also, it’s a push door.” He gave the door a demonstrative shove, sending it open easily. “See?”

But Eric couldn’t hear anything, between the thumping of his heart and the heated argument in his head.

“Say ‘Thanks, dude!” said the incumbent Eric-brain.

“Say ‘I love you!’” squealed the lovelorn Erica-psyche.

Eric choked out an “I L— thank you, dude.” after a few amazi uncomfortable seconds.

Kyle rubbed the back of his head, oblivious to the near-confession. “Hey, it’s no problem. And you’re super light now, so it was eas—”

But Eric had already turned and started tic-tak-ing his way inside the mall, trying — and failing — to suppress the wide grin across his cherry-red face.
12111.title: They head to the mall

choices: Eric decides to go clothes shopping
Eric decides to get his hair done
121111.content:
Thankfully, to Eric's immense pleasure, their destination was rather close to the entrance, so they managed to make it in before Eric had another incident.

"This definitely looks like how I expected." Kyle said, as they walked into the curio store, passing various artifacts on the shelves as they walked towards the counter.

The counter was un-manned, but Eric quickly located a bell on the counter and tapped it. Almost instantly, an older woman, maybe in her thirties, walked out from behind a beaded curtain leading into a back room.

"Yes?" she asked.

"Are you the owner?" Kyle asked.

"I was last time I checked." she chuckled. "Before you ask, we don't do returns. Only store credit."

"It's not that." Eric interjected. "We uh... heard that you had... experience with..."

"There's always been a rumor that you're a witch. Is it true?" Kyle bluntly asked.

"That depends." she replied. "Why do you ask?"

Eric and Kyle immediately explained their situation, as the owner listened intently, remaining silent until they finished.

"Very irresponsible, playing with magic that you don't understand. Do you have the book with you?" she asked.

"No, but I took pictures of the spell on my phone. We couldn't find any reversal spell." Kyle said, handing his phone to the owner.

"Ah, Transfiguration Feminam. Not particularly common, but one I've seen before. I assume he said it, and you happened to be in the room?" the owner asked, first pointing at Kyle, and then Eric.

"We both said it!" Eric exclaimed. "At the same time. But only I was transformed... for some reason."

"Magic relies on belief and desire. A spell like this requires the user to truly want the result." the owner said.

"And you had like, second thoughts at the end, you were telling me you didn't want to do it." Kyle added.

"And because in your mind, you had doubts, the magic refused to work for you." the owner finished.

"That's a stupid rule..." you muttered.

"Many rules are." the owner said.

"Whatever, can you reverse it?" Eric asked.

"Reversal is... complicated. This wasn't like say, turning into a frog or something, which is just a simple reversal. This requires an inverse spell."

"Inverse spell, like a transfiguration for men?" Eric asked.

"Exactly. Unfortunately, while I have seen it before, I'll need a few days to locate it." the owner said.

"What am I supposed to do for a few days? I can't walk around like this!" Eric shouted.

"If it's any consolation, you make a very pretty girl." the owner said, before turning to Kyle. "You have wonderful taste."

Eric blushed furiously.

"Thank you very much." Kyle said. "We really appreciate it."

"Don't thank me yet, I haven't fixed your friend yet." the owner said. "I'll call you when I find the spell."

"Come on," Eric muttered as he started to walk out of the store.

Kyle followed behind.

"What now?" Kyle asked. "If you're gonna be stuck like this for a few days, you're gonna need some clothes. I dig the retro look, but..."

"What I really need..." Eric brushed another strand of hair out of his face. "Is a haircut. This hair is driving me nuts."

choices: "I think ... I think, it's Kylie, now." Kyle announced.
"Your turn next, my sweet." Kyle looked intently at Eric looking for changes.
"I'm your fantasy." Kyle said, either a question or a statement...

122.content:
As Eric looked on, he watched, as Kyle's face contorted. He too, was trying to rise, but his body wasn't responding. Suspecting it was the firework, or whatever trick he'd played to make the flash Eric stood back still suspicious of further trickery.

However, in moments it was clear the flash, wasn't Kyle's doing... Or rather what followed was beyond him.

"I... I can't..." Kyle's voice was cracking. High and piping the distress in his eyes, as he tried to rock himself upright, to try to return some sensation, some control to his actions.

Eric watched as hair cascaded freely from Kyle's scalp. His short hair soon spilling over his shoulders, and onto the bed. Clearly able to feel the flow of his hair, it's growth at the periphery of his vision was making his eyes dart from side to side, to catch the actual motion.

"It's... It's real... The damned book's real!" Eric stuttered in disbelief.

Kyle could only roll his eyes, and give the weakest attempt at a shrug, the obvious fact far, far clearer to Kyle than Eric.

"Yeah... I guess, you know." he confessed, as he took in Kyle's transformation.

The aim of the spell seemed to hit them both at the same time. Their sense of humour now feeling like the deadliest of games. But, it was Kyle whose face was softening. Losing it's harsh male edges, and taking on an almost feline beauty.

"No.... No..." she mumbled, even now, her soft pleading tones sounded like a tease.

Her features became perfect, Eric's dream woman. He felt himself stiffen at her sight, at her vulnerability, as those full lips darkened, and plumped too inviting to refuse.

Unable to meet Kyle's eyes, his gaze drifted away. Not far, as the reason for Kyle's protests became clear. His nipples were spreading, becoming thicker, riper, fuller. Her eyes telling of a sensitivity and alertness that terrified him.

Soon, as Kyle's breathing shifted, his chest rose and fell. Rising higher each inhaled breath, and not sinking quite so far with every released gasp. Fingers twitching, as life and freedom was restored to them. Kyle's elbows flexed weakly, as they fought for movement.

The rocking of Kyle's head was feeble, but the denial was clear. A quick glance, just as quickly averted told that Kyle was now a woman...

Her lips trembled, the change not needing to be mentioned. She was intimately aware of her new sex. Her breath coming in shallow gasps, as she battled the nervous flip-flopping of her stomach. An ache... A need... A hunger, she didn't understand, but knew too well was building within her.

Finally free to, Kyle's hands belatedly came slapping into place covering her new bust. A proud, firm bust, such as only fantasy could want, or deliver. Kyle winced at the speed and pain of the impact. Those nips reminding her sharply they were new, tender and deserved care.

Kyle's tongue darted out, wetting those inviting lips. Ready to speak, Eric was eager to hear what she had to say.

As they finished chanting the words, a nervous chuckle broke from Eric's lips...

Kyle looked guilty, "Well, I don't suppose either of us thought it'd work... not really." An awkward smile of relief on his face.

"I wonder what's on TV?"

Before Eric could answer, his gaze dropped to the open book. The pages were glowing. Dazedly looking around the marijuana still too confounding. The room light wasn't overhead, a chuckling giggle burst from his lips.

Kyle's eyes were just as wide, just as unfocused, but he too saw the book filled with internal light, even the ink seemed to glow with a dark brilliance. Snatching his hands back, Eric gasped and copied the gesture. Both felt their skin prickle as if thunder and lightning were in the air.

But, they were both as startled as each other, as their clothes turned to dust, drifting to the floor, before vanishing on the hint of a breeze in the room.

"It'sss... It's real..." Eric goggled, almost giddy with excitement.

Kyle was still stunned, confused, and very, very stoned. His hands running over his bare flesh, as if this were some druggy delusion.

"So who was your dream woman... Your absolute fantasy..." he giggled, reaching out to brush his hands over Eric's just as naked flesh.

13.content:
“Prepare to experience a whole New You!”

This was the tag line of the motivational video you had just bought online. You saw an add for it browsing the web and strangely it had a near flawless review record. Thousands of people claiming it changed their lives forever.

Normally you were never the kind of person to buy into this sort of thing but right now your life was probably at its lowest moment ever.

Your name is Thomas Floyd. Until recently you worked at a center until a new program was developed that made many jobs obsolete. You were unfortunately let go from the company with barely any severance to keep yourself going.

Now unemployed your girlfriend decided she could do better and broke up with you. To make matters worse you discovered she is actually dating your older brother Nathan, who is a successful marketing manager at a huge company.

You spent weeks in a deep depression wondering why this had to happen to you. Was it fate or did the universe just hate you? Either way it seemed like you were the unluckiest guy in the world.

Finally a friend of yours Zach, got you off your couch and back into the world. This hardly helped however as your depression made it near impossible to find another job or find the motivation to do much of anything.

This video seemed like a last resort. You didn’t expect much of anything, but at this point you were desperate enough to try anything.

You took out the disc and plugged it into your entertainment system and turned on your tv. As you watched you were a bit surprised as a loud bright display appeared on your TV followed by text.

“Please use your remote to select and navigate from the following options.” It said first as you grabbed the remote.

The next thing you heard was the voice of a female announcer, her voice was loud but also gentle, like a talk show host.

“Greetings! Congratulations on making this important step in changing your life forever. My name is Jane and I will be your guide through this amazing transformation. By the end of this video your life will be forever changed in ways you never expected. Now let us begin...First off, tell me about your self. Are you Male or Female?” The voice of Jane asked.

Letters appeared on the screen as the choices for Male or Female appeared.

You were about to choose male, it was the obvious answer. However maybe it would be funnier to choose female? You never know?
13.title: New You

14.content:
Model Behavior: When his girlfriend's important fashion show is a model short, how far will one boyfriend go to ensure everything goes off without a hitch?

Reform Schooled: A petty thief is given a choice between jail time and a special new college. He takes the latter and finds that the school uses extreme measures to get success.

Gaining Influence: Wanting to make a quick buck, a young man decides to scam the internet with a fake feminine persona, however as "her" popularity grows, he finds himself falling deeper into the role of a girly social media influencer.
14.title: Something else

choices: Jessica asks you to be her model
Jessica asks you to follow her backstage
141.content:
It was Jessica's big day, for years she'd been trying her best working design jobs and she was finally able to impress her bosses enough that they gave her a chance at producing her own fashion show, and there was a top-tier French designer coming to see it to boot! You couldn't have been happier for her, as her boyfriend.

You'd seen her working the hardest she'd ever worked in preparation for the show, designing a bunch of new outfits that, even to a fashion layman like you, were remarkable, and you'd been helping behind the scenes, agreeing to work the lights and AV equipment.

As her boyfriend, you could always tell when she was upset, but you'd have to have been deaf and blind to not notice it when she walked out from backstage, looking as if her heart was beating out of her chest.

"Jess, what's wrong?" you asked, rushing over to her.

"Oh, Felix... it's one of my models." Jess whined.

Jessica had booked her models through the same agency that her company used, and as a result of them being talented, they were usually double booked and were flying around the country several times within a week. And this week, there happened to be a major snowstorm on one side of the country.

"And now I'm one model short and I was having her do a few changes, so that's like three outfits that won't go out on the runway. This is a disaster!" Jessica was on the verge of tears.

"Woah, now. Don't you have anyone else who can fill in?"

"The company told me to do varied sizes, so I picked one model for each size. None of the other models are close enough to even squeeze into them."

What about the agency?" you asked.

As it turned out, the agency was closed for the weekend, and the show was in just a few hours, and even if they had more time, it'd be very unlikely to find a specifically sized model on short notice anyway.

"I'm ruined. I'm never going to make it because my show is incomplete."

"Why don't you try to find a friend or something? Someone who fits the size but isn't a professional model. I mean, it can't be all that hard to drill them on how to walk the runway for a few hours, right?" you reassured.

Jessica started to dry her tears and sniffled a bit before smiling.

"You're right, I've got some calls to make." Jessica took out her phone and returned backstage.

As you continued testing the lights and cameras, (you were recording the show for posterity's sake) Jessica came back out and shyly approached you. You knew what this meant. She needed something.

And just what is it that she needs?
141.title: Model Behavior

1411.content:
"What's wrong this time?" you asked.

"Well, I did what you told me, and I went over all the sizes for the missing model. No one can fit into those outfits." Jessica said.

"I'm sorry, baby." you said, expecting the waterworks to start again, but oddly, they didn't.

"But I was talking with Ellie, the stylist, she's good at gauging sizes from just a look, and there's someone here who can fit the bill." Jessica continued.

"That's great!" you exclaimed. "So everything's settled?"

"Not quite..." Jessica got really quiet.

Suddenly, it clicked. The shifty quietness, why she's over explaining everything, you knew Jess, and you knew what was up. And you didn't much like it.

"Oh no..." you started. "You don't mean..."

"I can pay you for the day if that sweetens the pot?" Jessica asked.

"Honey, you know I love you, and I'd do anything! But... I'm not a model!" you replied. "I'd just ruin the show!"

"It's not that hard to just teach someone to walk down the runway for a few hours." Jessica said, mimicking your earlier comment.

"I meant someone who already knows how to walk in heels!" you insisted.

"Please!" Jessica begged, grabbing your hand.

You weighed the options, on the one hand, this was something you weren't enthused about, in-fact the entire idea made you nervous. Sure, there's the hit to your masculinity, but you were more worried about your lack of style or grace that might endanger the show. But if Jessica truly needed you... it was your duty to help.

After some thought, you knew exactly what to do.
1411.title: Jessica asks you to be her model

14111.content:
Looking into Jess' eyes, there was no other response you could give.

"If you really need me to do it... I'll do it." you sighed.

"Oh, Felix!" Jessica quickly embraced you in a hug, before pulling you into a kiss. "I knew you'd save the day!"

While that part you enjoyed, Jessica grabbed your hand and dragged you backstage, where the other models were getting ready. You had been acquainted with them somewhat earlier, and Jessica had likely told them of the arrangement beforehand, so all you got were a few glances as they continued their work of getting ready.

"Ellie! He said yes!" Jessica exclaimed as she brought you over to one of the vanities, where the stylist was waiting.

Ellie was a chicly-dressed woman with a rather commanding presence. She and Jessica had known each other since college, and if she barked an order at you, you did it.

"All right, strip down to your skivvies!" Ellie ordered.

You didn't even think about what you were doing until your shirt was off and your pants were around your ankles. You looked around, and the models were alternately averting their gaze, and sneaking peeks and giggles at your expense. You were a slight, lanky man, and so you could understand why Ellie would believe that you could pull off the dresses that Jessica designed.

"First, we have to get rid of all that hair." Ellie scrutinized you. "Jess, help me with this."

Ellie grabbed a jar of cream and started to rub it over your body, on your arms, legs, back, anywhere below the neck.

"Normally I'd suggest shaving or waxing, but we've only got a few hours." Ellie said.

"Thank god for small mercies..." you muttered.

After a few minutes, the cream started to tingle, and Ellie and Jessica wiped it off, along with your body hair.

"Now go put on a robe and take a seat, we've got to start with your..." Ellie started.
14111.title: You reluctantly agree

141111.content:
"We'll need to put in some extensions, and I don't have your exact shade, so I'll have to do a little dyeing." Ellie finished.

"Extensions? Can't I just wear a wig?" you asked, pulling on the robe.

Your hair wasn't exactly short, but it could easily hide under a wig cap if necessary. You weren't entirely thrilled with the prospect of changing your hair so permanently.

"Hardly." Ellie replied. "None of the wigs I have with me would match both your complexion, or the dresses. It's easier this way."

"Please? For me?" Jessica pleaded.

"All right..." you said, sitting down in the chair, and allowing Ellie to get to work.

The first thing she did was to rub some goop into your hair, which you guessed would lighten your hair from a very dark brown, to a dark blonde, as you saw Jessica placing hair extensions down onto Ellie's workstation.

You watched as Jessica walked around, fretting over the other models and checking everything over twice, as Ellie worked her magic to weave the extensions into your own hair seamlessly. A perfect match.

"Wow." you moved your head around and watched as the hair moved.

"Save it for the end, we've got a lot more to do, plus whatever style is needed for the first outfit." Ellie said. "Next up is..."
141111.title: Hair

1411111.content:
"Next up is your nails." Ellie finished.

"Is that really necessary?" you asked.

"Yes, everything has to be perfect!" Jessica insisted.

"All right..." you sighed.

"So, I'm going to do silk wraps for your nails." Ellie said.

"Silk what?" you asked.

"It's like acrylics, but less permanent and easier to remove." Ellie said.

That was good enough for you. You sat down and let her get to work, buffing your already short nails into evenness. Once that was done, she applied a clear solution, and then put a small piece of fabric on top of each of your fingernails, shaping it to the nail, before placing them underneath a small machine that gave off a blue light.

Once both hands were done, Ellie applied a different solution and put them back under the light, before shaping them into a modest length, and polishing them with a french style, with the tips painted white, and the rest a soft pink.

"Wow..." you remarked as you wiggled your fingers around.

"Classic, simple, and it goes with everything, so we won't need to keep re-doing them." Ellie smiled. "And be careful not to smudge them."

Ellie followed suit with your toenails, although thankfully all they required was a simple trim, buff and polish to match. As you wiggled your drying toes, Ellie moved onto...
1411111.title: Nails

14111111.content:
"I think I'm starting to have second thoughts." you started to stand as Ellie approached with a makeup palette.

"Please, Felix." Jessica pleaded. "Even if there was anyone else, the show starts in less than an hour. We don't have time for anyone else!"

Staring down at your manicured hands, you realized that you'd gone too far to turn back now. And Jess was counting on you. You sighed and sat back down.

"This is just something basic to get the contour right, to add a little femininity to your facial structure, before we have to go into what's needed for the different outfits." Ellie said, as she began to rub a makeup sponge on your face.

You weren't able to see much of what Ellie was doing, given that she was standing in front of the mirror, or telling you to shut your eyes as she applied the makeup. Once she seemed finished, you got to see your face, which was a far cry from what you'd expected to see. You expected to see yourself, but what you saw was a completely different person.

She didn't look like she was wearing makeup, but you could feel it on your face. In fact, with the hair and nails, the only thing giving you away was your lack of breasts.

Which Ellie was about to rectify.

"All right, I had this rushed over from my studio, sometimes I work with transgender clients, or the occasional drag queen, so I keep a few of these around." Ellie reached into a box and pulled out two breasts that you estimated were probably only a B or C cup, but seemed

"Those things are huge!" you exclaimed.

You looked around for Jess, but she must have been out and about doing the final touches out on stage.

"If you think those are huge, I should introduce you to some of my clients." Ellie giggled. "Now, the glue is gonna be cold, so..."

"Glue?" you cut Ellie off. "That's a bit too permanent for me."

"Well, it can't be helped. Some of the dresses are strapless." Ellie said.

You suddenly realized that, while you'd seen many of Jess' designs while she had perfected them... she didn't tell you exactly which ones you'd be modeling, you didn't really remember which ones might have fit you, since you'd never tried them on before.

"Open the robe and lay down." Ellie motioned as she lowered the chair back.

You complied and flinched as the cold glue touched your chest. After a few seconds of holding, the breasts were in place, and you were shocked as you looked down them, while Ellie touched up the makeup around them to ensure that they blended in perfectly with your skin. The seams were nonexistent.

Ellie quickly pulled a 360 degree curtain around the chair as she opened another box.

"What's going on?" you asked. "Isn't this it?"

"Not quite. There's just one small problem left." Ellie said, pulling out something that you'd never seen before, but you could guess its purpose.

"I don't think I'd call it a small problem..." you joked.

"Don't worry, this one doesn't need glue, I can strap you into this and hide it under the panties." Ellie said.

A few moments later, she pulled the curtain away as you pulled up a pair of panties over your now hidden male bits, and a bra over the breast forms.

"All right, Felicia, the hard part is over." Ellie smiled.

"Felicia?" you asked.

"Don't want anyone overhearing us call you Felix, right?" Ellie reasoned.

"Makes sense." you said.

"Felix! You look... amazing!" Jessica exclaimed as she walked backstage. "I almost didn't recognize you."

"Thanks." you blushed. "Everything going okay out there?"

"Yeah... except now we need someone to do the AV equipment." Jessica said.

"Crap!" you smacked your head with your palm. "I forgot about that..."

"How hard is it?" Jessica asked. "Could you teach me?"

"Yeah, but you'd need to be at the computer, and you can't direct the show from out there..." you pouted as you tried to figure a solution.

"You're cute when you're thoughtful." Ellie remarked.

"A ha!" you shouted. "I can program a remote to control everything. The remote's labeled fairly simply, so you could change the lights from a distance. The camera is set to run the whole time, so you'd just have to press record and let it go..."

"So we're good?" Jessica asked.

"We're good." you smiled, pulling on a robe. "Can I get some shoes?"

"Take these." Ellie slid over a pair of flip flops.

"I'll be right back." you said and tied the robe off as you went back to where you computer was sitting. As you programmed the remote...
14111111.title: Makeup

141111111.content:
You struggled slightly, getting used to your newly-lengthened nails, but only for a moment, it wasn't too hard to figure out how to type with them. The good part is that the remote was already half-programmed, you'd been setting it up as a fail-safe when Jess had recruited you into this.

Unfortunately, the universe seemed intent on causing ripples in Jess' show, as was reinforced when you felt a large hand on your shoulder.

"Need any help with that?" a man's voice asked.

You turned around, coming face to face with a well-dressed man, with a smile on his face.

"I'm fine." you returned to your work. You didn't need distraction, Jess needed this soon.

"You're one of the models, right?" he asked.

What a bonehead. Your voice wasn't that deep, but it had to give away the whole scheme, right?

"I'm also A/V." you coldly replied.

"Where'd a pretty little thing like you learn how to do that?"

"The same place you learned to be a condescending jerkwad. Now, unless you know how to slave an entire console's controls to a single remote control, kindly shove off!" you turned back to your work.

"Feisty, I like that. See you after the show." the man walked away, thankfully.

And you managed to finish your work with enough time to give Jess the run-down on how it worked.

"So, you pretty much told me how you wanted the lights on each dress, so each segment is its own button, the only thing you have to remember is your own order." you said as you handed Jess the remote.

"I think I can manage." Jessica said. "I really appreciate all you've done."

"You better." you smirked.

"All right, ladies! Showtime!" Jessica exclaimed.
141111111.title: A man approaches you

142.content:
Kyle Morris looked at his train ticket as the officer he was wife undid his handcuffs. As he boarded the train he saw several other men about his age getting on. They all seemed just as confused as he did.

“12 Months at Madame Sybell’s academy for vagrant young males.”

That was the sentence passed on to him by the judge for his crime. Kyle was caught a Rolex watch from a pawn shop. He thought he saw an easy opportunity when he was there to sell goods, too bad the security cameras caught him red handed and the police tracked him down.

Kyle had recently turned 21 and was facing a felony due to the value of the watch, however the judge offered him another choice.

“Son...There is a place. A very special place. It’s a school for young men such as yourself. Those who have made mistakes in their lives. They teach a very special course and if you pass the charges will be dropped. If you refuse or fail...It’s seven years in prison...” The judge told Kyle at his hearing.

Thinking it was the easy way out Kyle took the chance and agreed to go the school. He had never heard of it before but figured it would like high school and really just a waste of his time. 12 months of this had to be better than prison, right?

Though Kyle did notice that this was apparently a very popular option, based on how many other young men were on the train with him. Once the train arrived, they were all let off the train, before being linked up to a handcuff chain and led towards the premises.

The train tracks weren't that far from the gates, but there was nothing else stretching for miles. The place looked enough like a college, vaguely castle-like, there was even ivy growing up the side of the building. Nothing to imply anything less than a reform school.

Once inside the gates, the cuffs were released and the guards departed, getting back onto the train. But you and the rest of the group had already been turned over to the school's private security, who all wore little earsets like secret service agents. Before any time for pleasantries, they had you funneled into an auditorium where you were checked in by name and put into a seat, where a metallic collar was strapped around your neck. On the stage, an older woman, looking very much like a stereotypical headmistress, stepped up to the podium, and as she did, everyone's collar beeped and clicked.

"That was the locking mechanism. The collars are designed to ensure that you remain on the grounds. Any dissent or disruption will be met with a light shock, that slowly graduates to becoming more painful the more you disobey and any further disruption will lead to you being put into the... accelerated program." the woman stated, coldly. "I am Madame Sybell, the headmistress. You now all answer to me."

"I don't answer to anyone, bitch!" someone shouted near the front of the auditorium.

Any further shouting was quickly quelled as it was replaced by a yelp and the sound of someone falling to the ground. A few guards rushed over and dragged the offender out of the auditorium.

"Any other remarks?" Madame Sybell asked.

Nobody responded.

"Good. You are here because you are among the worst offenders that society has to offer. And that's because of how you were raised. But you're still malleable and we intend to do what the school system should have done. Turn you into proper members of society." Madame Sybell stated. "You will all be assigned a roommate, a student who has been here for nearly the amount of time that you will be, to guide you on your way. Any questions?"

No one responded again, and Madame Sybell clapped her hands happily.

"Now, you will be escorted to your rooms, where your roommates await your arrival. Good luck." Madame Sybell stepped aside as the young men were all corralled together again in order to get to every room.
1423.title: Something else

choices: A slightly feminine, yet gender neutral uniform
14231.content:
Once you're dropped off at your room, you hesitantly open the door. The room was decorated rather sparsely, likely an attempt to keep free expression to a minimum. On both sides of the room there were twin beds, a desk with a chair and a closet. One side was clearly lived in, as evidenced by the young woman with blonde hair wearing a traditional private school uniform sitting in the chair at the desk. She turned and smiled at you as you entered.

"You must be Kyle. I'm Cecilia, but you can call me CeCe if you'd like." she stuck out her well-manicured hand.

"Nice to meet you. I didn't realize this place was co-ed." you replied.

"That's a bit of a complicated explanation." CeCe giggled.

"You're a delinquent too? What'd you do?" you asked, incredulous that this bubbly girl could have done anything harsher than jaywalk.

"Truth be told? I robbed a convenience store at knife point." CeCe sighed. "I'm ashamed of that now."

"You're kidding!" you remarked.

"I was very different before I came here."

"Bullshit!" you exclaimed, before feeling a shock that brought you to your knees. "Ahh!

CeCe immediately tried to help you up as you recovered fro mthe shock.

"What was that?" you asked.

"We're not allowed to swear. Headmistress' rule."

"Good to know..." you rubbed your neck.

"Anyway, we don't have much time before class starts. You need to put your uniform on." CeCe said.

"Uniform? They didn't give me a uniform." you said.

"Check the closet." CeCe looked away, almost as if she was scared of your reaction.

You hesitantly walk over to the closet and swung the doors open. On one side, were a set of 6 uniforms identical to the one that CeCe was wearing. On the other side...
14231.title: Meeting your roommate

142311.content:
Opening the closet your eyes went wide at the so called “uniforms” available to you.

They were dresses....nothing but dresses. To make it even worse they were really short dresses. They were all skimpy mini dresses, the kind of thing you would have loved to see a girl wearing. Each one was identical to the next the only only difference was the color. There was a white dress, red dress, black dress, red dress, and yellow dress.

Below each dress was also a matching pair of colored high heels. They were quite tall and all opened toed to look as sexy as possible.

“What the hell is this?” You asked thinking this was some sort of joke. A small shock came to your neck as you winced in pain realizing you couldn’t even say the word Hell.

“Those are your uniforms silly. New recruits like you always get to wear the dresses. There is one color for each day of the week. On weekends we get to relax.” CeCe said from her bed.

“I’m not wearing any of this I’m a guy!” You said in protest.

Moving over to the drawers you opened them to find matching bras and panties that all seemed color matched to fit each dress perfectly.

“What is going on here?” You asked in anger wondering what kind of operation this place was.

“You are part of the program now, better just go along with t trust me.” CeCe replied.

“what program? This doesn’t make any sense!” You said in anger again.

You paused for a moment as you heard a beeping coming from your collar. All of sudden you stopped as you felt a bit strange as...
142311.title: An extremely feminine school uniform

142312.content:
On the other side... were a set of nearly identical uniforms to CeCe's, save for the fact that the skirt was replaced by a pair of shorts the same color as the blazer.

In fact, you took your first real notice of CeCe's uniform, she was wearing a charcoal blazer with pink trim around the edges, and the school's emblem over a white blouse and a gray and pink striped tie. She was also wearing a tartan-style skirt, a pair of knee socks and a pair of black high heels.

Your uniform featured the exact same blazer, blouse and tie, but featured charcoal shorts (which were a little short for your liking) and a pair of... black Mary-Jane flats?

"What the f..." you hesitated. "Heck is this?"

No shock, so light profanity was okay. Good to know.

"It's the school policy. All students wear identical uniforms, well, mostly. At least mostly at first." CeCe said. "But just put it on, class starts soon."

You weren't sure what she meant, but you reasoned that if they were providing the entire uniform, they probably saved money by having everyone wear the same stuff. Plus she seemed really eager for you to change, so you pulled a hanger down. You looked around the room.

"Is there somewhere to change?" you asked.

"Don't feel embarrassed on my account." CeCe said. "Nothing I haven't seen before."

"I'd still prefer if you turned around." you said.

"Suit yourself." CeCe made a show of turning around and covering her eyes.

You quickly stripped out of the prison jumpsuit you were in and changed into the provided uniform. The shorts were indeed shorter than you were used to, stopping at your mid-thigh.

"Are these supposed to be this short?" you asked as you slipped your feet into the shoes.

"Just about." CeCe said. "But before we go, there's something you need to do."

CeCe handed you a pink disposable razor. You looked at it in confusion.

"You'll get the handbook in class, but I want to save you the demerits. All students must be clean-shaven below the head on any visible extremities. So no facial hair, or leg hair." CeCe said as she opened a side-door into a small bathroom with a shower stall, toilet and sink.

"Thanks?" you entered the room and found a can of shaving cream in the shower.

It took some doing, and caused a few nicks, but you managed to get it done. Returning to the main room, CeCe was standing near the door, bouncing on her heels.

"Come on, we have to go now!" she demanded.

"Do we need books or anything?" you asked.

"No!" she grabbed your hand and dragged you out of the room and down the corridor, before quickly running into a classroom.

The room was full, with the entire class seated, save for four open seats. There was a clear divide, with half the room being girls, and the other half, the boys you arrived with. Rather strange. CeCe motioned for you to sit in one of the seats. You followed her lead and sat at attention like everyone else.

A few moments later, a bell chimed and a teacher walked into the room. As she set her things down on her desk, another set of students rushed in, only to both collapse to the floor seconds later as their collars began shocking them.

You turned to CeCe, who only glumly nodded. That's why she was so eager. What type of school was this place? As you wondered, the teacher began to speak:
142312.title: A slightly feminine, yet gender neutral uniform

143.content:
Your name is Michael Simmons, a slender 23-year-old guy with fair skin and slightly long blonde hair. You were always a relatively small guy throughout your whole life.

In general, you have always been something of a slacker and a trickster. You always tried to find an easy way of doing things and making yourself amused while doing so. This mindset of yours caused you to flunk out of college and chase your own parents to cut off financial support once they found out.

Currently, you were in your apartment trying to think up a plan to get cash quick. The funds you gained from a lottery you managed to win would dry up soon.

The idea came to you when watching some YouTube gameplays: You could become a social media star. You didn’t think it could be that hard, you just needed to be able to present something well and look good doing it. After a while, the cash would roll in.

The trickster in you then presented an even better idea: why not disguise yourself as a FEMALE star. You’d be sure to attract a sizeable male viewership with your girly physique despite being a man. All of them would be drooling after a pretty girl, with them none the wiser to your truth.

Once the plan was settled, you decided that the first step was to either set up the accounts or get all of the necessary “supplies”.
143.title: Gaining Influence

1432.content:
You decided it would be better to get supplies first, better to get all of that hassle out of the way before creating accounts.

In 10 minutes, you were looking through all the shopping sites, looking for clothing, makeup and some wigs if you needed them. After all, it would be better than shopping in department stores: you would get weird looks if you did.

Your supplies are up a substantial part of your cash, but you were willing to make that sacrifice for this plan of yours. Now, during the five-day shipping period, do you set up your accounts or just wait?
1432.title: Get “supplies”

choices: Skip to when the supplies arrive
14321.content:
The important part of the accounts, apart from creating an attractive influencer, was to ensure that the accounts matched the type that you were trying to emulate. That meant scouring Instagram, Twitter, Facebook and every other social media to cherry pick the best elements to make the perfect profile.

So far, you knew you needed to have a catchy username, some inspirational garbage plus some emojis, and there were so many ideas for topics, beauty bloggers, fashion, design, travel, workout, you could try your hand at all of it eventually!

"Username... username..." you pondered as you wondered who your feminine persona should be. It can't just be a genderswapped version of your name but it also had to be something simple.

After some thinking, you decided to name your feminine persona Simone Kaylson, with the username becoming "KaySimone" which seemed like it might lend itself to a good brand one day. Once all the accounts and bios were set up, all that was left was for the supplies to arrive and for Simone to be "born".

Which made it all the more irritating when your plans to sleep in were destroyed by a loud, persistent banging at your front door.

“Go away!” You yelled out, but now it appeared that it was now your guests turn to ignore you as the endless banging continued to be endless.

“Fine! Fine! I’m coming” you yelled out. You crawled out of bed and put on your robe while considering how answering the door in your underwear wouldn’t be unnecessarily rude- given the circumstances.

You arrive at the front door and hastily swing it open while sarcastically saying “how can I help you?” as a means of expressing your discontent.

Before you, you see an attractive female courier draped head to toe in her company’s industrial brown. It definitely wasn’t a suitable color for her, but boy did she pull it off.

“Wow! You really must have wanted to see me! It sounded like you were trying to knock my door down!” You tried flirting.

“Christie Smith?” She smiled.

“Yeah, I’m Chris T. Smith.” You responded.

She held out a tablet and stylus, “sign please”

“I’m not expecting anything”

“And yet, you’re still receiving something.” She smiled before repeating, “sign please”

“Fine,” you submitted and scribbled onto her tablet and she handed you an envelope

“Have a nice day!” She exclaimed professionally and walked back to her truck.

A few hours later, your eyes slowly opened and you yawned as you stretched your arms. As you stretched, you realized that there was something held firmly in one of your hands. The envelope. You quickly sat up and inspected the envelope.

"Didn't I leave that on the counter?" you asked. "Eh, maybe I didn't."

You sighed and started to open the envelope, pulling the tab and opening the top. Pulling out the contents, you discovered... a photograph. An 8x10 glossy photograph. Certainly not worth all the effort the delivery girl had put into delivering it, though subject of the photo was slightly confusing.

Blinking a few times as your eyes adjusted from sleep, you saw that the photograph was of a woman, you didn't recognize the room she was in, but could tell that she was somewhere important, as the dress appeared to be rather formal and she was wearing heels and full makeup. She even held a clutch purse in her hands to complete the ensemble.

"Wow, she's kinda hot." you remarked as you flipped the photo over, seeing a date written near the top. "That's in like... a week, right? Wonder why that date is on the photo."

Regardless, still strange that his photo was sent to you. Maybe it was a mistake? But the courier had the right name, so... You flipped the photo over again and started to look at the woman's face. Maybe you knew her from somewhere? She did look vaguely familiar to you. Something about her eyes... Why was she so familiar?

It looks a bit bigger than before, but not by much.

You tear the seal off of it and pour it’s contents out onto the table. Another picture slides out, and a moment later a pair of black panties follow.

“Whoa!” You initially thought seeing the undergarments fall out, until you inspected further to see they still had the retail tags on them. What was, before, a kinky gesture, has moved to a confusing realm. “What’s that supposed to mean?” You ask.

You look at the picture. It’s weird, this time the girl isn’t close to the camera. She looks as though she’s about seven feet away. While on one hand, her body holds a sexy pose but her face holds an expression of surprise or shock.

“She looks so familiar...” you say to yourself, “but where have I seen that FACE before?”

Just then you hear a clatter right before you. Your eyes dart up, following the sound to see the junk you had towering atop a chair topple over. You feel a sensation of relief, until catching your reflection in the mirror approximately seven feet away.

“Wait a minute!” You exclaim, your eyes dart back to the picture and then back to that reflection and then to the panties with the tag still on them, and then back to the picture and look at the date on the picture, “is that supposed to be...me?”

"The followers will be glad to have you back. Of course, the kingdom won't be quite what you left it as, but I'm sure you can bring it back to how it was." the courier said.

The princess appeared to have relaxed, since control of your mouth was suddenly returned to you and you were able to speak once again.

"What the hell is going on? Princess? You've got to explain this! Why me?" you started asking every question you could conceive of, but a sudden stop caused a break in your interrogation.

"Shut it! You're merely a vessel for my princess to return, I owe you nothing. Be quiet or I will silence you myself!" the courier ordered.

She was clearly much more than a run of the mill courier. You wanted to continue, but your mouth was again taken over by the "Princess" whoever that was, and your speech was muffled once again.

"Thank you, your highness. He was getting rather tiresome." the courier replied. "Shall I administer now?"

You, unwillingly, nodded and the courier plunged a needle into your neck, causing you to fall unconscious.

You suddenly awoke in a haze, still dressed as you were, but you were in some sort of castle. You weren't sure what it was until you heard a soothing voice speaking.

"This all started centuries ago. Long before you were born, of course. There was a small kingdom ruled by a Queen, and the throne was passed down to the first daughter of the family. This continued for countless generations, and usually, there would be a daughter and then a son, so no worries about any attempts to seize the throne, the sons understood. They typically became trusted advisers and ran the kingdom alongside their sisters."

You were unable to move as the room faded and was replaced with a castle courtyard, with a little girl running around with her father, and her pregnant mother sitting off to the side. This must be the "Princess" that the courier was referring to.

"However, one time, there was a second daughter instead, and she didn't like the idea of her sister holding all the power, refusing even an appointment as regent."

The scene shifted to one of the pregnant mother, the Queen, sitting with her older daughter, now fully grown, and her younger daughter, a teenager, angrily throwing a desk to the side in fury. The scene then shifted to the Queen's deathbed.

"When their mother passed, the younger sister orchestrated a poisoning that left the Princess dying."

"She had suspected her duplicitous sister had done it, so she made a deal with the court magician to pass her aura into another, a royal guard willing to lay her life down for her Princess."

"That's me!" you thought to yourself as you watched the scene unfold.

"I have returned, my subjects." your mouth replied, before the Princess held your, or rather her, manicured hand to her mouth. "Oh, how curious. What a strange voice. We can fix the small details later, though. I'd like to return to my kindgom as soon as possible."

"A private plane is sitting around back, ready to take off at your command for Samarra."

"My kingdom is in shambles... but it will be returned to glory soon enough." the Princess replied.

All of the subjects and their ruler soon piled onto the private plane, a rather nice one, given the supposed state of the kingdom. The Princess lounged in a reclining chair as the others bustled around the cabin.

"Anything to drink, my liege?" Gregory asked.

"No thank you, I think I'll have my first proper rest in this many centuries." the Princess replied.

"As you wish." Gregory said.

The Princess laid back on the chair and shut her eyes. As she did, you learned a surprising ability that you had gained since the ritual.

Before you could reach out and accept the clothes you felt a conflict in your actions.

“Regina, What is this?” The princess asked.

“Your highness requested more comfortable attire”

“I did no such thing!”

“Perhaps it was the vessel influencing you while you were asleep?”

“It must be! Is there anything you can do to muzzle his will? I can’t be caught dead wearing anything that isn’t complementary to my form.”

“Unfortunately, there is no spell we can cast that will eliminate him. It’s one of the downsides of having a vessel. The spirit of the vessel will always be present, even when you’re unconscious”

“Drats!”

“But we can be sure to monitor you during any instance where he might influence your actions. We’ll be certain to restrain him if we find you pursuing actions that are unbecoming of a princess.”

“That would be splendid.”

“Great,” you think to yourself, “now, even when you have control, you have to act like a princess.” As things went on, the outlook of your escape was looking bleaker. At this point, it was looking like only death would be your escape.

You’re walked back to the chair you were once sitting in, your heels are re-equipped and your mouth says to you, “Let’s just make that little thing back there our little secret. Okay, Christie?”

Here you are, back where you once were. You had hoped to get one woman out of you, and ended up acquiring another one.

You now had both sisters possessing you in a battle for control of your body.

“Brother,” the princess leans over to ask you, “do you have any ideas on how to resolve the kingdoms problems?”

The princess looked back over to you and said, “that advice was odd. I don’t really see how the attire of the village is going to help the drought or the hunger.”

1442.content:
As Chris got off the bus he was holding his suitcase in hand as he saw his aunt Michelle and uncle Bob waiting for him.

Chris wished he here for just a social visit. He honestly wished he was here for any other reason than why he was actually here...

Three months ago his cousin Samantha died tragically in a car accident. She was Michelle’s and Bob’s only child and set to inherit their business one day. This horrible loss came as quite a shock to their entire family and now they are just trying to pick up the pieces.

Chris was just a young 21 guy and almost the same age as his cousin Sam. They actually grew up together and were really good friends right up till about high school.

While Chris was rather average puberty had been much kinder to Samantha. By the time she was 17 Samantha had already become a home town beauty queen. She had long flowing blonde hair, an amazing figure, large bust, etc.

What always impressed Chris however was how her beauty never stopped Sam from supporting her family. She worked in their restaurant almost every day after school. She turned down cheerleading offers, even modeling jobs, to support her family.

After high school Sam started modeling on the side as a way of bringing in extra cash. Local businesses loved having her beautiful and bright smile to promote themselves. By the time she was 21 Samantha was practically a local celebrity in her small town.

Finally her big break came when a big name producer from Hollywood showed up and offered her a chance to land a serious modeling contract in LA. With the love and support of her family she took the offer and left....

While on the road however another driver drifted into her lane and ended all of Sam’s hopes and dreams in the blink of an eye.

The tragedy hit the town hard and Sam’s family hardest of all. With everything going on it was getting harder and harder to keep the business going for Chris’s aunt and uncle.

As a way of stepping up and trying to help Chris offered to take Sam’s place for awhile. Michelle and Bob agreed and decided to take in their nephew to help pick up some of the pieces.
1442.title: Taking Her Place

14421.content:
The car ride was awkward, as to have been expected. Chris had been up far too recently, for the funeral, and once he heard how bad business had gotten after, he had to do something. Both just for family, but also because he couldn't stand idly by and let something that Sam loved get destroyed. There wasn't much talk apart from pleasantries.

The arrival at the house was the same level of awkwardness. Aunt Michelle and Uncle Bob lived above the restaurant in the middle of town, it always made the most sense to them, since they had loved their work so much, that they'd stay close. But being relatively small, there was limited available space. Which meant that there was only one room for Chris to stay in.

"We're sorry about this, but we don't have any guest rooms." Aunt Michelle said as she helped take Chris' bags into Sam's room. "I know it might be hard..."

"I can't stay there, it should stay untouched. I'll just sleep on the couch." Chris insisted.

"No, no." Uncle Bob said. "Sam wouldn't have wanted us to keep a shrine. She'd want her room to go to good use. We didn't clear her things out, but..."

"It's not a problem at all. Actually, it might be nice to be reminded of her and the good times we had." Chris said.

Chris moved his bags into the room and set them down, looking around the room. It was mostly similar to how it had been when they were kids, but with some mature flairs to it. Her computer was still there, too. Chris delicately placed it into a drawer as he started to unpack his things.

He was likely going to be there for a while, since not only were his aunt and uncle losing their joy of running the business, but the people in town were equally disinterested in eating at the restaurant since Sam died, and Chris was determined to get them back into the booths and tables.

After getting set up at the house...
14421.title: Arriving at their house

144211.content:
Chris woke up ready to work as he yawned and got ready for the day. It was really strange sleeping in his cousin’s room. Everything of hers was still here. Her clothes, jewelry, even the band posters she had back in high school. He felt like she was going to walk in on him at any time.

Going into Sam’s old bathroom felt weird too. While it was nice to have his own private bathroom for once all of Sam’s things were still there too.

Chris jumped into the shower and began to clean up. He realized he hadn’t brought any toiletries with him like shampoo or toothpaste. He didn’t think it was a big deal as he saw Sam’s old shampoo bottle and body washes and began to use them to clean himself up.

Jumping out of the shower Chris noticed he didn’t have any five o’clock shadow like he normally did. He was always really prone to growing his facial hair real quickly.

“Huh...that’s weird.” Chris said feeling his soft cheeks. He shrugged it off like no big deal as he brushed his teeth and got ready for the morning.

Throwing on his jeans and shirt Chris headed downstairs as Michelle and Bob were waiting for him.

“Hey there...Sleep okay?” Aunt Michelle asked him.

“I guess...It’s still just weird for me.” Chris replied.

“I understand. Still it means the world to us that you are here lending a hand.” Michelle replied.

Bob and Michelle soon began to show Chris the ropes. Everything from how to use the cash register, to the menu items, cleaning and busing tables, as well as customer service with ordering.

It was a lot to take in all in one day but since it was just the three of them Chris had to learn pretty much everything. Bob ran the kitchen and Michelle ran the floor. Chris was the one in between getting everything else done.

After a long day They finally closed down. Chris was exhausted being in his feet all day. How did Sam manage this for years?

Going back to bed Chris fell asleep knowing he had another full day ahead of him tomorrow.
144211.title: Chris' first day of work

1442111.content:
The next morning went essentially the same way, still no stubble, getting dressed and heading downstairs to work, until the lunch rush happened. Well, if one could call it a rush anymore. It was only a small group of regulars, but they were the only ones keeping the business alive, so they were appreciated. As Chris rushed around making sure that everything was running smoothly, Michelle called him over to a table she was waiting at.

"What's up?" Chris asked as he walked up to the table.

The table was inhabited by two people, one around Aunt Michelle's age and one around Chris' age, or actually, exactly his age, because as he would soon find out, Morgan was Sam's best friend.

"Chris, this is Stacy Jones and her daughter Morgan." Michelle said. "This is my nephew Chris, I was telling you about."

"Hi." Chris politely introduced himself.

They seemed nice, though Morgan was predictably sullen, it was hard for Chris to be here in general, but he didn't have a choice. To be eating where your best friend used to work... it had to be tough.

"I can definitely see the family resemblance." Stacy said. "I bet you've heard that a lot."

"Not that much actually, but then again, I don't think we've looked alike since we were kids." Chris remarked.

"Say, you're relatively new in town, right?" Stacy asked. "Morgan, you should give him a tour, take him to all the local sights!"

"Oh, that's not necessary. I spent a lot of time here as a kid," Chris started.

"Nonsense! You can't spend all day in here and then go straight upstairs. You need a social life." Michelle remarked. "We won't be busy once lunch is over, so you can take off then."

"I guess." Morgan replied, clearly not enthused, but seemingly understanding why the two women were so insistent.

If your current experience with Morgan was anything to go off of, she definitely needed something to take her mind off of Sam, hell, everyone did, but at least Aunt Michelle and Uncle Bob had work to distract them.

"What do you say, Chris?" Michelle asked.

Chris pondered over his decision for a moment before...
1442111.title: The next day

14421111.content:
“Sure, that sounds nice.” Chris said a bit reluctantly.

For him it was an excuse to get out for awhile and help take his mind off of things. From the look on Morgan’s face it seemed she needed the distraction as well.

“Awesome, Morgan you can swing by tomorrow morning and pick up Chris.” Stacy said happily like she was planning a play date with children.

“Sure...” Morgan said still not excited about this arrangement.

Chris finished up his day at work and went down for the night relatively easy. It wasn’t nearly as busy as Bob or Michelle would have liked so clean up wasn’t a problem.

In the morning Chris woke up yawning as he got up to get ready for his hang out with Morgan. He wasn’t thrilled about this still but he still felt obligated.

Jumping in the shower Chris began to clean up as usual when he began to feel something odd tickling his toes...

Looking down he saw small pools of hairs around his feet as his eyes began to widen. He felt around his head for any balding spots but felt nothing. If anything it felt thicker and longer than usual.

That’s when he noticed it. As he scrubbed his arms he saw his arm hair thinning and falling off. Not just his arms either it seemed his leg hair and general body hair seemed much thinner and finer as usual.

“It must be all the stress and depression.” Chris thought to himself. At least he wasn’t going bald.

Jumping out of the shower he still noticed no stubble at all yet. In fact his felt actually felt a bit smoother than usual.

He got dressed and ready for the day as he received a text that Morgan was waiting for him downstairs.

Heading down he saw Morgan waiting for him as the two went off to explore the town.
14421111.title: Chris accepts the offer

choices: Chris gets curious and snoops around Sam's room
144211111.content:
Morgan seemed a tad more upbeat, but not by much. The experience was likely a welcome distraction from her sadness about Sam. Still, she was doing her part, pointing out the sights, the movie theater, the bowling alley, the high school that both Sam and Morgan attended, though there were a few points where she seemed to stop abruptly and change gears, likely because her anecdote would have veered into discussing Sam, which Chris gleaned from her attitude was probably still very painful for her. Still, it's not like they walked along silently.

"You seem pretty close with Aunt Michelle." Chris remarked.

"Yeah... They were always like a surrogate family to me, your aunt and uncle. And..." Morgan trailed off.

"Sam was like a sister?" Chris finished.

"Yeah. It's just hard... it's been a few months but I can't stop thinking about her." she said.

"Neither can I. Hell, living in her house, in her room... it's weird." he said.

"You're staying in her room?"

"Yeah, that's not weird, right?"

"No, it's just that..." Morgan hesitated.

"What were you gonna say?" Chris insisted.

"We used to hang out in there a lot, more when we were kids but... I haven't been there since before..." Morgan trailed off.

"I'm sure you could have asked Aunt Michelle and she'd have let you in." Chris said.

"Oh yeah, sure, 'Hey, I know your daughter is dead but can I hang out in her room for a few minutes?'"

"I can see why that would be awkward. But while I'm staying there, you can drop in whenever you'd like."

"You mean that?"

"Yeah. It's 'my room' after all, right?" Chris remarked.

"That means a lot, Chris." Morgan smiled.
