"Don't mention it." Chris smiled back.

After that, Morgan got a whole lot more energized and was more willing to open up about Sam, sharing her memories and experiences must have been cathartic, especially with someone like Chris, going through the same feelings of loss that she was.

The day was fun and they promised to do something together on Chris' next day off. Once he returned back, he went to Sam's room to relax. Though after talking with Morgan, his curiosity was piqued. He had learned a lot from Morgan about Sam, he wondered if any remnants of that were scattered around the room. What if he were to snoop?
144211111.title: Hanging out with Morgan

144211113.content:
Making sure he was decently dressed, Chris met Morgan downstairs, just standing idly by. Honestly, getting a better look at her, she was pretty cute, what with her good figure and brown hair. Still, that was hardly appropriate for the moment. This was meant to just be a fun outing, not a date.

"So....um, hi," he said, trying to muster a smile. Admittedly, talking with strangers had never been a really strong point. Sure, he was okay enough to handle the restaurant so far, but this situation was a bit different.

"Hello," Morgan replied simply. She didn't sound rude or angry or anything. If anything, it seemed like nerves much like his own. Clearly, she wasn't sure how to handle this little walk of theirs as well.

"So.....um....." Chris already felt like he was repeating himself with how he was talking. "Sorry if...this is really awkward for you...."

"No no it's okay..." Morgan trailed off a bit. "I'm the one being a stick in the mud. I just....haven't figured how to handle this yet...."

"Well, neither have I...if that helps," Chris chuckled just a little, which actually got a little smile out of Morgan. Wow, a pretty cute smile at that.

"Well, despite me appearing otherwise, thanks for agreeing to come along," she said. "Things have just been a lot quieter of late."

"I can imagine," Chris nodded.

The two of them didn't really set much of any real destination, just enjoying a little walk around town. Chris of course did know a lot of the stuff around, but not so much around some of the newer developments, to which Morgan was better off explaining.

"They actually have a pool in the area that used to be run-down. Pretty popular too. Sam and I always hung out there a lot during summer," Morgan explained.

"Sounds fun," Chris nodded. "I admittedly haven't been to one of those in a while."

"Well it's only going to get hotter so maybe we'll check it out," Morgan smiled a little. "On that note....there actually is a spot Sam and I would often go to. Want to see it?"

"Is...that okay?" Chris asked.

"I think it would be better to," Morgan replied. "Might actually help to put some things to rest rather than just trying to ignore my feelings."

Sounded like reasonable logic to him. Putting all this out in the open might help them to move on. Besides, it was a prime chance to learn a little bit more about them.
144211113.title: Something else

1442111131.content:
To Chris’ surprise Morgan actually took him away from the city and up towards the woods overlooking the town. Chris really was looking to go into a nature hike but Morgan assured him they weren’t going far.

Morgan led Chris down a old hiking trail mostly forgotten by the looks of things. The trail finally led them to a small clearing in the woods. It was nice and secluded, a peaceful little hiding spot.

“This was our spot. As kids Sam and I used to come up and break all sorts of rules.” Morgan said with a slightly cheeky smile.

Chris was a bit surprised. Sam always seemed like such a goody two shoes to him. It was surprising to hear she actually had a bit of a wild side.

“What’s kinds of rules?” Chris asked a bit curious.

Morgan blushed a bit. “Oh...all sorts of things. As kids we used to paint our nails or braid our nails here. As we got older we would sneak up here with drinks or bring boys.” Morgan said with a laugh.

“Wow...perfect little Sammy used to drink underage and mess around with boys in the woods?” Chris said a bit shocked.

“Heh not just boys.” Morgan said blushing.

“Wait...you two?” Chris said shocked.

“We were just a little bi-curious. We both had boyfriends at the time.” Morgan said blushing a little amazed she admitted this to someone she just met.

“Hey its all cool. I won’t say anything. Those memories are precious I wouldn’t want to spoil them.” Chris said looking around a bit.

Morgan thanked Chris for his discretion as she led him back to town.

“How long to you plan to stay?” Morgan asked him as they headed back.

“A few months a least, maybe a year. It depends on the Bob and Michelle.” Chris replied.

“Well this was kinda nice. Maybe we should do this again?” Morgan asked a bit nervous.

“Yeah, come by the restaurant some time and we can make plans.” Chris said as they arrived back at the restaurant.

Morgan nodded as the two went their separate ways. To his surprise this was actually a nice evening.
1442111131.title: Heading to their favorite spot

14421111311.content:
Suffice to say, Chris was a little surprised by everything he had learned. Not just about Sam and Morgan as they had their walk through town, but also their talk in the woods. Still, it was charming all the same to learn a little more about his cousin. Morgan seemed like a really nice girl too. He was actually quite anxious to spend more time with her. It helped to have someone his own age to talk to in this town.

Well, in any case, it was time to get ready for work again. In what was already becoming a routine, he got ready and showered. Kind of surprised him at how fast he was getting accustomed to being in Sam's old room. Being in a girl's room was kind of weird, yet kind of humbling all the same. In any case, he didn't think much on it. It wasn't like he spent a lot of time in it anyway so far.

As he showered, he noticed the same thing he had the last couple days, that being how smooth his skin was. Honestly, it didn't seem all bad. His skin had never looked so clean and blemish-free, despite all the hair loss. Maybe it was just a combination of stress and the shampoo being used or something. Oh well. It wasn't exactly something that was hindering him. He could live with it until everything returned to normal.

Although, he did also notice this time how much fuller his hair was, not to mention longer. It was long enough to cover his ears, looking a whole lot bushier than it used to. Then again, it had been a while since the last time he had gotten a haircut, so perhaps it was just that time. It wasn't exactly hindering him all the same.

So, he got all dressed, heading down for some breakfast. Bob and Michelle both said good morning to him, asking him how the walk with Morgan went since it was a little bit late by the time Chris got back. He replied that it went very well, much to the delight of both his relatives.

"That's good. Morgan really needs the support," Michelle said. "She and Sam were practically inseparable."

"I can imagine," Chris smiled, digging into breakfast.

Eventually, it was time for the restaurant to begin its day. At the very least, Chris was starting to feel more comfortable in the role. Certainly helped when everyone was pretty nice.
14421111311.title: The next morning

144211113111.content:
Chris was cleaning up a table in the middle of his shift as he saw a familiar face come through the door. It was Morgan and she had a really happy look on her face.

“Hey long time no see.” Chris said with a smile.

“Hey, I just wanted to drop by and see if you were still down to hang out later this week?” Morgan asked.

“What were you thinking?” Chris asked.

“Well a few old friends of ours are coming back into town and I thought we could go out for some drinks?” Morgan said.

“Ours Chris said confused.

“Sorry...I meant Sam and I’s friends from school.” Morgan said a bit embarrassed.

“No problem, sure that sounds fun, when you were thinking?” Chris asked.

“A couple days from now, Saturday night.” Morgan said.

“Sure count me in.” Chris said nodding.

Morgan left soon after as Chris finished up his shift. He kept brushing the hair out of his eyes as he figured he would have to do something about it soon. He was noticing a slight positive change since he started. A few older customers had started to come back. Bob and Michelle told him they were old regulars who stopped coming when Sam passed but now they felt happy to come in again.
144211113111.title: Talking with Morgan

choices: Chris goes to get a haircut
Chris runs into Morgan on the way
1442111131111.content:
The next morning, Chris' hair was even longer! Chris wondered if that was even possible, but he hadn't really been himself since Sam died, so maybe he'd just been neglecting it so long and he was only noticing it now, since he was finding new ways to cope, and being in town was helping with that. Before his shower, Chris made a mental note to ask Aunt Michelle about a good barbershop in town, and after his shower, he grabbed a hair tie off Sam's dresser and used it to pull the hair out of his face.

He also noticed that his skin seemed smoother, especially his arms and legs. Not just because the hair had fallen out because of stress or whatever the reason was, but there was little evidence that hair had ever been there in the first place. No remnants of any follicles. But it wasn't a big deal, so Chris elected to ignore it for the time being.

After getting dressed and heading down to the restaurant, Chris got to work. Today was the best day yet! Even more customers, and as Michelle and Bob noticed, they were all former regulars. Seems the town is finally getting over Sam's death and doing their part to make sure the restaurant stays in business. In the middle of the day, Chris was fumbling around behind the counter with the hair tie, since strands kept falling out and getting in his way as he tried to work the register. Michelle noticed and walked over to Chris.

"Having trouble with your hair?" Michelle asked.

"Yeah, it's never done this before, but I guess I've never had it this long." Chris replied.

"That's the curse of our genetics. Unruly hair, your mother and I went through the same problems. So did Sam, now that I think about it." Michelle got misty-eyed for a moment before shaking it off.

"Maybe I should get a haircut on my break. Any good ones in town?" Chris asked.

"Of course, there's a barbershop and a salon right down Main Street." Michelle replied.

During his break...
1442111131111.title: The next day

choices: His hair is long and flowing like Sams.
14421111311111.content:
During his break, Chris decided to head down and check out the barbershop. Might as well, given how unruly his hair seemed to be today. It was pretty odd though, as he never had this much difficulty with it beforehand, and its growth seemed oddly quick even though he knew it had been a while since his last cut.

Well, guess there wasn't much point in cutting it, given that problem would be taken care of. Eventually, he came across what he was looking for, which seemed to be a barbershop and salon mixed together. Well, it made things efficient at least. Someone getting a haircut may feel like getting everything else.

In any case, he walked inside, getting the attention of the woman at the desk.

"Hello, I'm Diana," she smiled. "How can I help you?"

"Yes, my name is Chris. I'd just like to get a simple haircut today," he introduced himself. Diana nodded, though briefly stopped.

"Chris....you wouldn't happen to be the same Chris from the restaurant, right? Sam's relative?" she asked.

Sheesh, it was like being related to a celebrity, which Chris supposed Sam was to these people more or less.

"Yes, I'm her cousin," Chris wryly smiled a little. Might as well take it in stride.

"I thought so. Sam really did a lot for everyone," Diana smiled. "She was a regular here as well whenever she needed some fixing up. Here, come on in. How about we give you the full works for your hair? On the house."

"Really?" Chris asked, not wanting to take advantage of them. "I don't really want to trouble you...."

"Nonsense," Diana said, bringing Chris inside. "I think it's the least I can do for how much you're helping out. Really, I've been seeing more people with brightened spirits since your family's restaurant got going again."

Well, that seemed to be the end of that. Chris was in for this one way or another. He supposed he could allow Diana and the others to do what they please, so long as his hair looked nice in the end. The last time he had been at a salon was to get his hair straightened out for high school graduation.

And from what he could tell, this was shaping up to be just like that, feeling Diana messing around with scissors and washing his hair and the whole works. She was certainly doing a lot of pulling from what he could feel, though it seemed to loosen up later.

Eventually....
14421111311111.title: Chris goes to get a haircut

144211113111111.content:
The first thing Chris noticed was that the length hadn't really changed apart from some split ends, and his bangs, however, it had gone from unruly to immaculately styled almost like magic. Seeing it in the mirror brought up several different emotions for Chris, especially when he was shown the hairstyle from the back, since it reminded him of how Sam's hair used to be. Memories flashed of following behind Sam and seeing her hair shining in the sunlight. Almost like the light reflected off of Chris' hair right now...

"It's..." Chris started. Truthfully, he felt it looked a little girly, but there was something about it that he really liked. "Really nice."

"I'm glad. Though it helps that you have great hair. Unruly, but in the right hands, easy to style. I admit, I wasn't sure what to do when I started, but this seemed like the right path to take." Diana said. "How do you take care of it?"

"Nothing special really." Chris said, telling her the name of the shampoo he'd been using lately.

"That's what I recommend to all my customers. Keep on using it and if you ever need more, let me know." Diana said.

"Will do." Chris replied.

"Say, this is a bit of a weird question but... I really like how this came out. Would you mind if I took a picture for our social media?" Diana asked.

"Uh..." Chris started, surprised by the question. "Sure. You like it that much?"

"It's my best work in a while, I'll tell you that." Diana said. "I like to post ones that come out really well, you know, entice potential customers."

"Sounds great." Chris smiled.

Diana pulled out a camera and started to take photos from several angles of the hairstyle. Once she finished,

"Thank you very much for the haircut." Chris said, standing up out of the chair.

"Don't mention it. It was very nice meeting you, Chris. Brought back a lot of fond memories of Sam." Diana said.

Chris just smiled and walked out, content that not only did he get a free haircut, but he also got to help yet another local business through Sam's death. He thought he was just helping his aunt and uncle, but it looks like his presence was doing good for the whole town. As he walked...
144211113111111.title: His hair is long and flowing like Sams.

1442111131111111.content:
On his way home Chris noticed more people smiling and waving at him. It made him feel happy as he smiled back feeling a bit weird since he really didn’t know any of them.
Once he was back at the restaurant a few customers complimented his hairstyle as well. Bob and Michelle both liked it as well.

After his shift was over Chris went up to bed and called it a night. He felt rather nice considering how depressed people had been recently. Today was the first day he was starting to see some form of happiness return to the town.

The next morning Chris yawned and woke up like usual as he got up and jumped into the shower. As he cleaned his hair he noticed it felt even longer than before...How was that possible?

Once he was out of the shower Chris dried off as he looked in the mirror and saw indeed his hair had grown longer. The tips were now past his shoulders. Upon closer examination he also noticed his roots were lighter, they seemed to be turning a bright blonde color.

“This is crazy...” Chris said looking to his hair. This couldn’t be possible...right?

Chris went back to his room and looked at an old photo of Sam. She had long bright blonde hair down to her waist right before she passed away. Looking back to his own he noticed a few similarities but that had to just be a coincidence right?

Either way There was nothing he could do about it now. Chris combed his hair and tied it up in a ponytail not even realizing he was doing it perfectly with no prior knowledge of how to.

Getting dressed Chris felt his clothes were a bit awkward. He noticed they felt a bit baggy. Had he lost weight? Shrugging it off for now Chris went down to the restaurant and was a bit surprised at what he saw.

There was already a line starting to form outside as a few regulars had already returned smiling at Chris as he put on his work apron and began to open up. Everyone was greeting him and smiling at him as they entered. Even Bob and Michelle looked happy for the first time in months.
1442111131111111.title: Chris heads home

14421111311111111.content:
Suffice to say, things were getting a lot livelier than Chris ever imagined. Not that this was a bad thing of course, as his relief for things turning better for his family outweighed any potential awkwardness. Perhaps just a little spark was all that was needed for things to really get going again.

Granted, it certainly caught him off guard at how many people were willing to talk to him now. Not that anything was particularly wrong before, but people seemed to be more outgoing now. He began to learn the names of a lot of people, ranging from a lot of little kids to some teens and young adults to more elderly people. It was actually kind of overwhelming.

"Phew.....what a day," Chris wiped his forehead during lunch break.

For the most part, he had put aside any potential oddities regarding his appearance. The ponytail seemed to work well enough with his hair, and no one seemed to find it odd. Guess it was alright, although he probably should get it cut sometime. Speaking of hair, he actually looked through his phone and saw an advertisement for Diana's salon, showing off the pictures taken of him front and center. He actually kind of blushed at the attention.

"Well....at least it's helpful," he said, chuckling sheepishly.

Aside from that, his clothes were certainly a little baggy, though not to the extent that anything bad would happen. He felt his torso through his shirt, feeling just a little slimmer overall. Granted, he did feel like he could lose a few pounds from the summer snacking he did before, but this was kind of new.

Although, if there was an issue, it might be with his shoes, as they were feeling incredibly loose, no matter how much he tied them up. Now that was particularly odd. Perhaps he should bring that up with his family or Morgan. Maybe get some new ones since his current ones were kind of old.

Speaking of Morgan, he and her did have some occasional talk through texting. Nothing too big, just ordinary stuff. It helped to have someone else to talk to. Of course, she did remind him of the get-together happening tomorrow on Saturday. Although, she did say she wanted to stop by after he got off work. Perhaps enjoy some time together, which was okay by him. He honestly really wanted to see her again. She was pretty cute...not that that had anything to do with it of course.

And by the time work was beginning to slow down, Morgan made good on that deal.

"Hi Chris," she gave a bright smile, perhaps her biggest yet since meeting him.
14421111311111111.title: After work

144211113111111111.content:
After his shift ended Morgan dropped by looking happier and brighter than he expected. She seemed genuinely excited to see him. Chris never thought of himself as a charmer or ladies man ever but maybe there was something here?

The pair decided to grab coffee at a small local coffee shop about a block from the restaurant.

Chris made a mental note that Morgan was dressed up a bit more than last time they met. On their first encounter Morgan looked like she just gotten out of bed. She had worn baggy clothes, worn out tennis shoes, no real effort put in at all.

This time however he noticed she had cleaned up a bit. Her hair was combed, she was wear hip hugger jeans, a decent blouse and flats. Nothing too special but Chris noticed it helped a lot in bringing out her cute feminine side.

At the coffee shop the two talked about how things seemed to be improving recently around town. The energy and life of people seemed to be returning.

Morgan also made mention of Chris’ hair saying how nice it looked on him. They talked for about an hour confirming the get together tomorrow evening. Morgan said her and Sam’s former friends were really excited to hang out together.

After hanging out Chris went back to his room and hung out until bed. His appearance while still odd, not bothering him as much now as he felt like his presence here was actually starting to do some good.
144211113111111111.title: Spend time with Morgan

1442111131111111111.content:
Waking up, Chris opened his eyes to the first Saturday he was spending here. Of course, the restaurant was still open today as usual. Felt pretty strange to actually work on a Saturday, but he had to he supposed. Supposedly, Saturdays weren't too bad here and thing we're already less desperate with the increase in customers over the past couple days.

It gave Chris some measure of relief for things to be working out, though he wondered if the quick turnaround meant he might not spend as much time here as originally intended. Eh, that would surely work out on it's own.

On that, Chris went in to shower. However, as he did, the awkwardness of his appearance came back to light. He really was thin. Not unhealthily so, but still significant enough to be noticed. Plus, was it just him or was his hair now fully past his shoulders? It appeared to be between his shoulders and waist now, with streaks of blonde being a lot more prominent. Okay, this looked considerably weirder than before.

"What is going on?" He wondered as he showered. He couldn't figure out why. He didn't feel bad, but didn't feel great either.

Well, keeping it in mind, he finished up and got dressed, pulling his longer hair into a ponytail again. The difference in his clothes was more prominent though.

As a matter of fact, his shoes slipped right off.

"Dang it...." He groaned. He couldn't exact go out with nothing.
1442111131111111111.title: The next morning

14421111311111111111.content:
He knew for a fact that Uncle Bob's shoes wouldn't fit, a family in-joke was that he was secretly Bigfoot on the side, so Chris was out of luck, if he was going to be on his feet all day, he'd need something that wouldn't slide off every time he lifted his foot up off the ground.

"What to do..." Chris mused.

Of course, the easy solution was staring him in the face, but it wasn't a solution he really wanted to think about. The connotations of gendered footwear aside, he didn't want to start rifling through Sam's things. Besides, what if they didn't fit?

Chris picked up a slipper that was sticking out from under the bed and held it up to his foot. A perfect match.

"Chris, get a move on!" Michelle shouted from downstairs.

"Guess I don't really have a choice." Chris reasoned as he started looking through the various shoes set about the room for something suitable.

He found a few pairs of heels, mostly for formal occasions, some sandals and flip-flops, and a pair of sneakers, but they were fairly worn and weren't presentable to be wearing at work. Almost like fate, the next pair his eyes glanced over was a pair of shiny black dress shoes with a sort of a low wedge heel at the back. Thinking back, Chris could remember seeing Sam wear a similar pair of shoes while working a few times when he had visited in recent years.

Chris slid them onto his feet and tested them out. The fit was good, and they completed the ensemble in a way that he felt gave his outfit a spark of professionalism. Like he wasn't just working there out of familial obligation. He was a team member. It felt right.

Chris smiled as he took a few steps towards the door.
14421111311111111111.title: Finding a solution

144211113111111111111.content:
With little choice Chris had to settle for the wedges as he slipped them on and put on his clothes for work. His normal outfit was way to big now. He was practically swimming in his shirt and pants now. His belt tightened as much as it would go. He figured he would have to find new clothes soon but now he had to focus on work.

It was the busiest day yet at the restaurant. Chris didn’t even have a second to spare as people started flooding. The strangest thing however was everyone seemed to know his name. Even people he had never seen before were calling out to him.

At first this made Chris feel really awkward. How did all these people know him? Why were they so happy to see him? What had he done to deserve their attention? It made him feel really uncomfortable at first but soon he stopped caring and began to enjoy it.

As he worked Chris noticed a bit of a tightness around his waist that he was trying to ignore. It started off small but as the day progress it was starting to hurt and get really annoying...

“You okay Hon?” Michelle asked noticing Chris was wincing in pain as he cleaned off the counter.

“Yeah...fine...I’m just...oops.” The pain distracted Chris as he dropped a plate causing it shatter on the ground.

“I’m sorry I got it...” Chris said bending down when suddenly he heard a loud ripping noise behind him...

Chris’ jeans had split right down the middle. Embarrassed he stood up quickly and excused himself before anyone could take notice.

Running upstairs Chris went to the bathroom and got out of his pants as he looked to them confused. They felt so much bigger than what he was used to why all of sudden did they fee tighter around the hips?

Dropping the ruined pants Chris stood there confused when all of a sudden his eyes went wide. He saw the culprit behind the pain and rip. It was his own body!

He stared at his hips and backside in the mirror. Somehow his hips were much wider than before. Not only that his butt looked bigger. It was rounder, almost perfectly tear drop shaped.

“This...isn’t right.” Chris said as his head began to feel a bit fuzzy. He knew this wasn’t right but for some reason he wasn’t totally freaking out right now.

He heard his Aunt calling his name as Chris knew they needed him back. His pants were ruined though so there was only one real choice...

Chris pulled out a pair of Sam’s old pants. There were right hip hugger jeans that hugged his new hips and behind perfectly.

Heading back downstairs work became much easier now with the pain gone as Chris found himself back in the strangely comfortable environment of the restaurant.
144211113111111111111.title: At work

1442111131111111111111.content:
Eventually, it was time for his lunch break, and as things would have it, Morgan happened to stop by at that moment. Honestly, Chris had to wonder how she really seemed to have an idea of when he was going to go on break.

Still, guess that didn't mean much. He was happy to see her.

"Hi Morgan," he smiled.

"Hi Chris," she chirped, looking more lively than ever. Seriously, Chris had to admit she looked really cute. There wasn't much sign left of the depressed girl from a few days ago. "You're looking great."

"Oh? Really?" Chris blushed a bit. "Um, thanks. I had to grab some of Sam's stuff. My old shoes and pants wouldn't fit."

He actually recounted the whole incident to Morgan, to which she laughed at which got Chris laughing a little as well. Unbeknownst to Chris though because of all the restaurant noise, it came off as a pair of giggles.

"Well you look the part," Morgan smiled. "Sam had an incredible figure. Honestly, I was kind of jealous for a time."

"Oh? Well....I think you look nice too...." Chris said before stopping. Wait, that didn't count as hitting on her right? "I-I mean...."

To his surprise, Morgan just giggled again, not seeming offended in the slightest. Actually, while Chris wasn't sure if it was intentional or not, she ended up holding his hand, making him blush again.

"Thanks. That's sweet," she smiled. "Come on, let's go have some fun together while you have your break. Some special time before tonight's get together."

Was she asking him out or something? Chris found it hard to tell for sure, though his face was surely still red thanks to this conversation.

"Uh, sure. Whatever you like."

Morgan didn't really wait for an answer. She was already pulling him along, not letting go of his hand once.
1442111131111111111111.title: Morgan stops by

14421111311111111111111.content:
Morgan took Chris around the block to a small ice cream shop nearby.

“This is my favorite spot. I swear this is the best ice cream ever created!” She said with a bright smile.

“Wow, that’s a pretty high bar to pass.” Chris said with a chuckle.

Inside Chris looked over all the flavors available, wondering what sounded good.

“Hmm...I think have the strawberry surprise.” He said. For some reason it sounded really good. Normally Chris was a chocolate guy but this sounded better.

“That’s funny, that was always Sam’s favorite.” Morgan said as she ate her mint chocolate chip.

The two of them sat down and finished up their ice cream as Morgan looked over to Chris with a really cute smile.

“What’s up?” Chris asked blushing a bit.

“Nothing..It’s just...memories. So...uhh...I was kinda wondering something....Next weekend some of my friends and I, people you will meet tonight. We are heading to a water park. Would you like to come?” Morgan asked.

“Like water slides and stuff? Yeah that sounds fun. I’ll make sure I clear it with Bob and Michelle.” Chris replied.

“Awesome! Anyways I got to head out I’ll see you tonight around 9 Okay?” Morgan said as they finished up their ice cream.

Chris finished up his ice cream as he grabbed a napkin to wipe himself. As he tossed it away he paused for a second looking to his hands. Were his fingernails getting longer?
14421111311111111111111.title: Going out

144211113111111111111111.content:
After the little outing, Chris got back to work, which resulted in the same organized chaos as before. By now, he was kind of getting accustomed to how quickly everyone seemed to know him, which was still really awkward even though it made things a lot easier to deal with. Some customers tried to hold some little conversations with him all the while, to which he wasn't able to carry too much but he tried his best.

His clothes bothered him a lot less, at least below the waist for the most part. Sam's pants actually seemed to hug his legs surprisingly well all things considered, with the wedge shoes supporting his feet well. It was a surprising sensation, if not unwelcome. His shirt was still baggy as heck though, although not as bad. Perhaps he would have to sub that out at some point as well. Well, for today at least, it wasn't too much of a concern. Granted, that little point about his fingernails still stick with him, especially whenever he used his hands to help customers to their tables. They really did look longer, and like they were well-maintained. Not that Chris didn't care of them beforehand but this seemed like a whole lot more.

Honestly, this whole thing just felt so weird, only helped by the fact that everyone was being so nice to him and that felt good at the least. Plus, Morgan was a whole lot happier, and that put a considerable jump in his step above all else. Oh, and while this was going on, he made sure to ask Bob and Michelle regarding Morgan's water park idea, to which they happily said Chris should be free to go to it, assuming of course nothing unexpected happened.

Chris was happy about that, and decided to text Morgan about it as quickly as he could regarding it. The quick reply came bearing a whole lot of excited emoji's plus hearts and kisses and such, which was pretty cute. Chris felt his face heating up again at it all, but it felt nice. He'd have to make sure his swimtrunks still fit though.

Anyway, after the restaurant was done for the day, Chris set about getting ready. Granted, he wasn't too sure what to do. Maybe just dress really casually? Problem was that his clothes were getting really weird with him. His old pants absolutely refused to cooperate with his wide hips, which he wondered if they were even bigger now compared to earlier today.

Welp, since he figured simplicity was best, he stuck with the same hip bugger pants as before, which felt just a little tighter now. Honestly, his underwear underneath felt a little strained by this point, but not much he could do there. Putting aside the wedge shoes, he decided to go with the worn sneakers, which also seemed to fit well. As for a top, well he wasn't sure about going through more of Sam's belongings, but they seemed to be all that would work so far. He hoped she wouldn't mind.

In the end, he found a blouse, though a really plain one all things considered. He figured it was close enough to his typical stuff and chose it.
144211113111111111111111.title: After work

choices: Chris is really popular at the club
1442111131111111111111111.content:
Around 9pm Morgan came to pick up Chris. Heading down to meet her Chris was actually surprised at how dressed up Morgan was. She was dressed up more than he had ever seen her before and actually looked rather sexy.

She was wearing a black dress that clung to her body tightly and barely came to her mid thigh. Along with matching black heels her hair and makeup were also fully done. She even painted her fingernails and toenails a shiny jet to match. The dress showed her neckline nicely and showed off a decent amount of cleavage. It was clear she wasn’t wearing a bra underneath which was showing off her perky C-cups nicely.

Honestly seeing her all dressed up made him feel weird. Not weird in the traditional sense like he was used to. Almost like a strange jealousy feeling he couldn’t quite explain.

“Hey you.” She said with an almost wicked smile.

“Hey yourself...Damn you went all out.” Chris replied a little shocked still.

“I know...Sorry to pull this last second but there has been a small change. Joey, one of my friends got us into the new club downtown. It’s hot and hip with good music and drinks. Is that okay?” Morgan asked.

“Oh...uh...sure.” Chris replied now feeling really underdressed. His own clothes didn’t even fit anymore so what was he supposed to do about going to a club?

“Do you wanna change? I can wait. I can even give you a hand.” Morgan asked with a wink.

“Really?” Chris asked thinking that sounded like a good idea.

Chris invited Morgan inside and up to Sam’s old room. It was the first time she had been inside since she had passed.

“Heh...it’s just like I remember...always the goodie goodie on the outside but a total party girl on the inside...” Morgan said with a laugh.

“What do you mean?” Chris asked. Morgan has mentioned Sam liked to do stuff before but hadn’t gotten too specific.

“You think Sam would keep her good stuff just lying about?” Morgan asked sarcastically.

Morgan got on her hands and knees and went under the bed. Tucked way in the back was a suitcase that Morgan pulled out smiling.

“This was her special case. Full of all the stuff she never wanted her parents to see.” Morgan said unzipping the suitcase.

Chris was a bit shocked at what he saw. The case was filled mostly with clothes. All of them really sexy and revealing. Mini dresses, mini skirts, tube tops, crop tops, high heels, thongs, g strings, lingerie, etc.

“Damn...I never knew Sam had such a wild side.” Chris said as he picked up a lacy bra examining it. 36 DD, wow he had forgotten just how busty Sam was.

“Honestly it’s not surprising to me. She had to always be such an Angel to everyone all the time. It only made sense to me that she had a real Wild side deep down to compensate.” Morgan said.

“What should i wear?” Chris asked curiously.

Morgan looked through the bad and tossed him a pair of jeans and a black shirt. The jeans were full of tears and rips that were obviously made there on purpose. They almost showed more leg than they covered. The shirt of a black mesh crop top. It would obviously leave the belly exposed and be partially see through.

“You...sure?” Chris asked feeling a bit weird about wear this.

“Yeah take these too.” Morgan said tossing him a black thong and match black heels.

“Uhh...I’m not so sure about this.” Something was definitely off here. Why would she be asking he wearing these sexy girl clothes. Also...why did he sort of want to wear them?

“It’s okay...trust me.” Morgan said with an almost hypnotizing stare.

Chris sighed as he agreed and put on the clothes. To his surprise they were a perfect fit. They hugged his body nicely. The heels too felt really awkward. He expected them to hurt or feel weird but strangely he actually sort of liked them...

“You look amazing...come on...” Morgan said taking his hand as they went off together.
1442111131111111111111111.title: Morgan picks him up

14421111311111111111111111.content:
The two walked out, Morgan never letting go at any point, not that Chris minded. He was more occupied with how his clothes felt. It was odd just how well they fit. The thong seemed to settle on his butt rather easily, while the heels didn't hurt even when walking on the sidewalk. Still, he kept those concerns to himself.

Morgan eventually had them cross another street, leading to a decently sized structure that you could hear from the outside. Chris had been to clubs with friends before, even if he didn't go crazy at them. However, this had to be one or the loudest ones he had ever seen. For such a quiet town during the day, it had quite the night life.

Morgan took care of getting them inside thanks to her friend, allowing Chris to get a view of the place. Certainly, it was as lively as expected.

"Come on!" Morgan giggled as she took Chris's hand again. "Everyone's ready!"

She took them well into the club, eventually meeting with a few other people Morgan introduced as her friends. They all seemed to be pretty outgoing, all giving Chris large welcomes. It was kind of overwhelming, though not unwelcome.

From there, it was a bug case of drinking and dancing around, to the point where Chris lost sense or time. He got to know the names of all of Morgan's friends, and they all crowded Chris constantly like he was the highlight of the party. Heck, even see random passerbys wanted to stop and talk.

It was kind of overwhelming, yet not too bad for Chris, given how it seemed to make everyone happy. When it came to dancing, he was reluctant at first, but got roped into it at everyone's insistence. Surprisingly, he seemed to be pretty good at it, at least everyone else seemed to think so.

"Shake those hips!" shouted another of Morgan's female friends.

Funny enough, he ended up doing just that, moving his larger hips and butt around like had them forever. Honestly, he couldn't help but marvel at their size while he was doing so. The large hips well contained within the tight jeans with the thong riding up his butt a bit.

"Having fun?" Morgan asked as they danced next to each other.

"Yeah honestly. More than I thought," Chris smiled. "This is far more lively than any I had gone to before."

"I'm glad. Everyone was so eager to see you," Morgan giggled before getting a little closer. "Nice to have some time together too."

Chris agreed with that, despite still feeling kind of odd about all this. He had noticed through his dancing that his hair got in his face a lot. When he combed it back, it was flowing down to his waist, and looked considerably more blonde as well. Was it just the lighting?

He wasn't sure, but decided not to bring it up with Morgan and possibly ruin the moment. They just enjoyed their time in the club. Speaking of time, once Chris actually got a moment. He saw that it was nearing midnight, which Morgan also noticed.

"Hey, want to go to the special spot soon?" She asked. "It's got a marvelous view at this time of night. It'd be a nice place to wind down."

Almost sounded like something out of a romance novel when out that way. Eh, he was making too much out of it.
14421111311111111111111111.title: Chris is really popular at the club

choices: You tell him your real name, Chris.
You feel compelled to tell him your “real” name, Sam.
144211113111111111111111113.content:
Before Chris could answer, a guy approached, smiling at Chris. “Hey, can I buy you a drink?”

You glance at Morgan, who smiles at you and nods, though you notice the sad look in her eyes. Before you can make any official decision of your own, you find yourself being dragged over the bar.

“Sorry about that,” The guy rambles, “I’m new around here and really nervous but you seem really nice and so I thought you’d be a good first friend. Especially since you seem to be known and liked by so many people. I’m Brandon by the way. Who are you?”
144211113111111111111111113.title: Something else happens

1443.content:
The New Office Girl:

For a Halloween party at your office you decide it would be really funny to crossdress as an over the top sexy woman. At first it seems everyone loves your outfit except for the really stuck up woman who works in HR. As the day progresses however you soon find yourself unable to remove the outfit as you begin to slowly transform into kind of woman you dressed up as!
1443.title: Something else

14432.content:
My Fair Lad-y: When a popular girl bets her best friend that she can turn any nobody nerd into the prom queen, her friend tries to skew the bet in her favor by choosing a boy as the target. The popular girl initially believes herself to be sunk, but a bet's a bet, after all.

A Storybook Day: After getting lost in the forest, a young man is drawn into the heroine role of a classic fairy tale.
14432.title: Something else

144321.content:
Outside their lockers, two high school seniors were arguing with each other.

"No way!" Penelope insisted. "You can't do it."

"Of course I can! It's not that hard. You just give 'em a makeover and boost her confidence, and boom! Instant prom queen." Kendall rebuked.

"Care to make it a bet?" Penelope asked, sticking out her hand. "The usual arrangement?"

"You're on, girlfriend. I bet that you can pick any nobody, socially awkward outcast, and I can get them elected prom queen." Kendall replied, shaking Penelope's hand.

"Then it's a bet!" Penelope stated. "Now... let's see."

Penelope started to look around the halls, until she located the perfect target.

"Let's see Kendall turn that into prom queen..." Penelope giggled to herself.

"Him!" Penelope pointed.

"Him?" Kendall turned to see.

Who did Penelope point at?
144321.title: My Fair Lad-y

choices: Kendall approaches Billy at his locker
1443211.content:
Kendall pursed her lips and furrowed her brow. There was no way that she could win the bet now! Turn a gawky girl into prom queen? Easy, but a boy... She'd never even considered that Penelope would pick a boy. Then again, considering the wager, maybe she should have.

Just look at him! Long, dark, greasy hair, big glasses, acne, plus he spends every day after school in the shire or wherever Dungeons and Dragons took place. Kendall wasn't feeling too good about her chances anymore.

But she couldn't let on, no, she'd have to try her best at this. After all, maybe she could make a butterfly out of this caterpillar. Billy wasn't unattractive, per say, acne is easy to clear up, get contacts maybe, and a pretty girl like Kendall could wrap any geeky boy around her finger enough to get him to wear a prom dress. But could he win Prom Queen? They'd have to see.

"What do you say?" Penelope asked, expectantly.

"I'll do it!" Kendall triumphantly stated.

"What?" Penelope gasped.

"You heard me. It'll take a lot of effort, but I will turn Billy Howard into Prom Queen material. Just you wait and see." Kendall said.

"Good luck." Penelope chuckled, though only to hide her surprise that Kendall had called her bluff.

"Now, to figure out how to approach him..." Kendall started to think
1443211.title: Billy Howard - D&D Geek

choices: Billy takes Kendall up on her offer
14432111.content:
Kendall waited until lunch, which was the first time of the day that their paths crossed. She watched him as he ate his sandwich at the so-called "loser's table". Most of Billy's friends got school lunch, so they were on line on the other side of the cafeteria. This was her chance. Kendall sauntered over to Billy's table, to the shock and surprise of most of the lunchroom. There were even audible gasps, but Kendall ignored them. She sat down across from Billy and smiled at him. In response, Billy's mouth fell open.

"Hey, Billy." Kendall said.

"Uh... hi... uh... Kendall." Billy quickly took a big gulp of his soda. "What brings you here?"

"Oh, I was just thinking, we've had classes together for years, right?"

"Yeah... since pre-school."

"And I've always wanted to get to know you better, but we were both so busy."

"And you were always popular and I'm just a geek."

"That's true, but I figured that, once we graduate, we might never see each other again, I should make the effort."

"R-really?" Billy asked. "You want to get to know me? Be friends?"

"Maybe even more than that, who knows?" Kendall winked.

If this was a cartoon, Billy would have melted into a puddle on the floor.

"What do you say we hang out after school today? Maybe you can teach me about that game you play."

"You're telling me, that Kendall, the most popular girl in school, wants to play D&D?"

"If that's what you call that game with the dice, then yes." Kendall put her hand onto Billy's shoulder. "Meet me at my locker after school if you're interested."

Kendall walked back to her table and returned to her friends, setting the equilibrium of the cafeteria back to the way it should be. Billy's friends returned to the table in shock and awe.

"Were you just talking to Kendall? What did she want?" one friend asked.

"She said she wants to be friends." Billy replied. "Do you think she likes me?"

"I think it's a prank."

"She wants to meet after school, I guess we'll see then."

"Are you gonna do it?"

"Well..." Billy started.

After school...
14432111.title: Kendall approaches Billy at lunch

144321111.content:
Billy walked up to Kendall's locker, half expecting to see a member of the football team ready to make fun of him for believing that Kendall wanted to hang out with him, but to his surprise, he found Kendall waiting there.

"Hey!" Kendall lightly tapped her hand onto Billy's shoulder.

"Hey." Billy sheepishly replied. "I almost thought this was gonna be a prank."

"A prank? Of course not." Kendall laughed. "Lead the way, Dungeonman!"

"Dungeon Master." Billy muttered.

"What?" Kendall asked.

"It's Dungeon Master, that's the title, but you can say Dungeonman if you want." Billy replied.

"See? I'm learning already!" Kendall giggled.

Billy wouldn't suspect a thing.

They decided to hang out at Billy's, since he had all his game books there, and it didn't make sense to lug them all the way to Kendall's. Plus, she was more than happy to make the trip. No one else was home, which allowed Kendall to sneakily get intel while she went to the bathroom.

Billy's hygiene setup was predictably poor, and she made notes on her phone of where she'd substitute in her own regimen for Billy.

And Billy didn't have any sisters, so she might have an advantage since he wouldn't have much experience with women's clothing.

"You okay?" Billy knocked on the bathroom door.

Kendall jumped but regained her composure. She opened the door.

"Oh yeah, just touching up my lipgloss." Kendall smiled.

"Anyway, you can come into my room, I've got the table set up and we can go over your character." Billy said.

Kendall followed Billy and sat down opposite him at a folding table. Billy handed her a sheet of paper and a pencil. Kendall read the sheet and smiled as she thought of an idea.

"Maybe this won't be so hard after all..." Kendall thought to herself.

"So this is a character sheet, and basically you just fill in your attributes, species, name, stuff like that." Billy said.

Kendall made a show of pursing her lips and scratching her head.

"I'm not sure what to put for any of this. Can you teach me?" Kendall asked.

"Oh yeah, uh..." Billy wondered how to teach her, after all, all his games involved people who already knew the ropes.

"What if you make a sheet and I copy off of it, like homework?" Kendall asked.

"That's a great idea!" Billy exclaimed as he pulled out a sheet for himself. "Okay, so I usually pick names later, so I'll start with the species. You've got elves, dwarves, halflings, gnomes, what do you want to be? I usually go elf, so I'll do that here."

Billy notated on the sheet.

"And then gender, you can just put what you want. Self explanatory." Billy started to write in "Male", but Kendall stopped him.

"Do you ever like... I dunno, play as a girl elf?" Kendall asked.

"I don't think so, I usually stick to male." Billy replied.

"Why? Is it different?"

"Not really, but..."

"Since I'm a girl, why don't you make this new character a girl, so I know what to do?"

"Good point." Billy said, erasing male and replacing it with female. "Although gender is different for the elves..."

Kendall endured the entire spiel as Billy filled in his character sheet.

"And I think the name for a female elf archer should be... Faelynn."

"Faelynn? That's pretty."

"Thanks.... I think."

"Totes a compliment." Kendall smiled and played with her hair.

The character sheet ate up most of the afternoon, and Kendall had to go to a hair appointment, so she started to leave, but before she did...
144321111.title: Billy takes Kendall up on her offer

1443211111.content:
Kendall picked up her bag as Billy started to gather up his books and reorganized them. Kendall noticed Billy idly scratching a zit and hit upon an idea.

"Uh, not to be rude or anything, but do you use anything for that?" Kendall asked.

Billy face flushed and he covered up the zit he had been scratching with his hand.

"Nothing really works for it." Billy sighed.

"Oh, I didn't mean it as an insult. I was only asking cause I know this cream that works miracles. Had a huge zit the day before picture day last year and it cleared it up in like six hours!" Kendall said. "Give me your number, I'll text you the name of it."

"It's not a big deal..." Billy scratched the back of his head.

"Come on! What's the worst that can happen? Your acne stays the same?"

"All right." Billy handed Kendall his phone.

Kendall quickly sent a text to herself, before responding with the name of the cream.

"When do you want to pick this up?" Billy asked as Kendall handed his phone back to him. "If you're not interested, it's fine..."

"How about tomorrow?" Kendall asked.

"Tomorrow's great!" Billy was shocked.

"Awesome, see you in school!" Kendall happily left Billy's house and headed to the salon as Billy started to research that cream that Kendall told him about.
1443211111.title: Kendall makes some hygiene suggestions

14432111111.content:
The next day at school, Kendall noticed that Billy's face was slightly redder than usual, a tell-tale sign of the cream, which meant that she was making progress. After gloating a bit to Penelope, Kendall quickly made her way to Billy's locker and headed back to his house, where she was introduced to his mother.

"Who's your pretty new friend, honey?" Mrs. Howard asked as they walked through house.

Billy profusely blushed as he tried to push Kendall towards the stairs.

"Just a friend, mom!" Billy said.

Kendall pushed past Billy and walked up to Mrs. Howard.

"I'm Kendall. And it's very nice to meet you, Mrs. Howard." Kendall said.

"And polite, too! What brings you here?" Mrs. Howard asked.

"Billy's been teaching me Dungeons and Dragons." Kendall replied.

"Really? I wouldn't have guessed." Mrs. Howard said. "You don't seem the type."

"I like to try new things, and this seemed fun. And Billy is such a good teacher."

"You'd better go upstairs before I embarrass him to death." Mrs. Howard said.

Mrs. Howard chuckled as Billy got even redder than before, and that wasn't the acne cream doing that. Kendall giggled and followed Billy up to his room.

Once up there, Billy got out the two character sheets, and laid down his latest campaign onto the table, grabbing a few figurines off his shelf. Kendall picked one up and scrutinized it.

"What are these?" Kendall asked.

"Miniatures for the games. I like to paint them and customize them for our games. That's your character, an Elf archer. Mine's an archer, too, but I made my own for her." Billy showed off a much more detailed figure.

"Wow." Kendall remarked. "You paint these yourself?"

"Yep." Billy beamed. "I might have gotten carried away, but I usually do with my characters."

"Let's start the game, then!" Kendall placed her figure back onto the table, but not before making another mental note.

Billy started to DM, and also played along as Faelynn, since a one-person campaign was rather boring. He ended up spending most of the game teaching Kendall about dice-rolls and initiative, but it was still a fruitful day for the two intrepid adventurers.

Even more fruitful for Kendall, who was getting far more of a grip onto Billy's interests, and ideas for how to manipulate them for her own gain.
14432111111.title: The next meeting

choices: Billy asks Kendall to remove the polish
144321111111.content:
A week later, Kendall's plans were working out better than she had imagined. Not only was Billy's face clearing up, but her subtle influence had started to take hold, and she'd convinced Billy to bring his D&D stuff to her house, course she'd only decided that during school, so he had to rush home to grab his things.

Which gave Kendall just enough time to set up in her room. When Billy arrived, let in by Kendall's mother, who knew to expect him, Kendall was set up with separators on her toes, and an open bottle of nail polish.

"Ooh! Darn!" Kendall hissed. "I thought you'd take longer, I wanted to redo my pedicure."

"It's no problem," Billy insisted, putting his bag down. "I'd have to set up and stuff, so take your time!"

Kendall pouted and looked thoughtful for a moment.

"Although... you paint those figurines. How about you do my toes and you can remind me what happened in the last session." Kendall asked.

"Oh, I dunno." Billy looked down. "Figurines are pretty different than toes, I don't think I'd be any good."

"What if I showed you?" Kendall asked. "Take off your socks."

Billy hesitated, but Kendall batted her eyelashes and made a pout that broke through his defenses easily. Billy pulled off his socks and sat on the the bed.

"It's really easy... of course it helps if your toenails aren't ragged and dirty..." Kendall giggled as she grabbed Billy's left foot. "Allow me."

"Sorry..." Billy muttered.

Kendall started to file and trim each of Billy's toenails. Before too long, he was the owner of ten expertly pedicured toenails.

"And now, pay attention." Kendall picked up her bottle of pink polish.

She started moving towards Billy's big toe, but Billy pulled his foot back.

"What's wrong?" Kendall asked.

"Can't you use something... I dunno, less noticeable?" Billy asked.

"I could... but you wouldn't be able to see what I'm doing to learn." Kendall reasoned. "Plus, it's my favorite one."

Billy thought it over for a moment, and with another bat of her eyelashes, Billy accepted Kendall's reasoning and extended his foot back into her lap.

"All right, so watch closely." Kendall started to paint.

Several minutes later, Billy's feet both had identical separators to Kendall's in between the toes, and Kendall was lightly blowing on Billy's right foot to dry the polish. Billy giggled.

"Tickles." Billy laughed.

"Usually I'd do a clear coat, but I think you've got it down by now, right?" Kendall released Billy's foot after checking the polish again. "Just be careful not to smudge it."

"And you'll remove it before I leave?" Billy asked.

"Scout's honor." Kendall replied. "Now, let's see if I'm as good a teacher as you."

Kendall passed the bottle of nail polish to Billy and he got to work, as he summarized their last D&D session, explaining the grand exploits of Faelynn, and Kendall's character. Once he finished, they got to playing for a little bit until...
144321111111.title: One week later

144322.content:
You were really starting to regret wanting to shave a few minutes off your trip home. Your car had broken down on the side of a highway, your phone battery died, and while following the roads were safer, you knew that you could cut through the forest in one direction and pop out right near a local park that was on a bus route. You grabbed a flashlight from the trunk and headed into the woods.

The woods were dense and dark, with no discernible path or any way to tell which direction led out. You got turned around pretty quickly at first, so you didn't even know if you were still going the right way. Your first spot of regret was when you started hearing strange noises that had no identifiable source. Sure, there might be wild animals, but nothing you couldn't scare away... unless there was a bear...

"Calm down, this is just your imagination playing tricks." you said to yourself.

As you approached what looked like the path back out into civilization, you forged ahead, pushing out of the darkness and into a brightly lit, sunny meadow, which had a path next to it, looking up the path, you saw something in the distance. You squinted your eyes and your heart jumped, there was a...
144322.title: A Storybook Day

choices: You notice long golden hair growing from your head
You see your fingernails growing longer
1443222.content:
In the distance you saw a tower, it was made of stone and looked like it dated back to the medieval ages. You had lived in this city your whole life and never before had you seen this structure before.

“What the heck is that?” You said squinting as saw the old looking tower in this strange meadow.

The weather was unfortunately not improving as dark clouds began to appear over head. A loud book of thunder indicated a storm incoming as you felt raindrops starting to fall.

“Great...I’m gonna catch pneumonia if I stay out here long...” You said as the rain started to pour down.

Picking up the pace you hustled to the tower pounding on the door for someone to let you in. You just needed to dry off and use a phone.

To your surprise the door swung open as you hit it as you almost fell inside. Quickly you moved inside the tower to get out of the pouring rain as you shut the old wooden door behind you.

Looking around you were surprised to see lit candles lighting the staircase that seemingly led to the top of the tower. There was no other pathway as it seemed this tower was very authentic on its old school medieval design.

“Is this a movie set or like a real old tower?” You asked yourself seeing there was no working electricity.

Somebody had to be home because these candles couldn’t light themselves. You called out up the stairs.

“Hello? Anybody home?” You called out only to hear an echo return.

Soaking wet you tried to dry off near the candles as you were shivering from the cold. You could feel a warmth coming from upstairs however. Hoping you could dry off you made your way up the old stone staircase as you climbed your way up.

It took forever. You were panting and exhausted by the time you reached the top of tower. When the stairs finally did level out you saw a large wooden door opened into a large and lavish looking room.

Poking your head inside the room you saw a large fireplace with logs burning as you immediately felt the warmth start to soothe your soaking wet body.

“Hello?” You called out not seeing anybody around at all.

The room was quite large. It looked like somebody quite well off, or as well off as one could be in medieval times. You saw lots of fancy old school dresses hung up on the walls, a vanity set and a fancy bed, you saw hair brushes...lots of hair brushes. On almost every cabinet or table there was a hair brush lying around. You saw a bookcase filled with old looking books. The only view of the outside however was a large window over viewing the valley and meadow you came from.

“This looks like the set of some kind of fairy tail.” You said laughing to yourself as you warmed up by the fire. You assumed whoever was here earlier to set the fire would return and you could explain your situation then.

As you looked around you notice there was a small podium with a large book already open on it. Looking at the cover you saw it was labeled “Classic Fairy Tales.”

Flipping through the pages you paused for a moment as you saw a drawing on one page. It was a picture drawn of a beautiful woman who was naked but had incredibly long golden hair.

https://data.whicdn.com/images/10168105/...

“Rapunzel and her tower.” The page said as you remembered the story from you were young. There was a Princess who was locked in a tower by an evil witch and was never allowed to cut her hair because it was magic and allowed her to live forever. One day a prince showed up to save her but the only way into the tower was the princess window. So she let down her hair as the prince climbed it to rescue her. The two embarked on an adventure together as the evil witch chased after them to recover her lost prize.”

You said the story description out loud as you yawned since you had hear this before. As you were about to turn the page you suddenly winced in pain as you realized you had gotten a small paper cut as a single drop of blood fell from your finger onto the picture of Rapunzel in the book.

You sucked on your finger as you noticed something odd. The blood that dropped from your finger didn’t stain the page. In fact it was as if the picture was absorbing it. The blood was sucked into book as it faded away as the letters on the book began to glow gently...

“Uhh...okay this is getting weird.” You said slamming the book shut as you turned to leave the room. Maybe you were just imagining things.

You turned to leave the tower when all of a sudden the door leading downstairs suddenly slammed it self shut! You tugged and pulled as hard as you could but the door wouldn’t budge...

“What is going on here?” You asked as you suddenly began to notice something odd...
1443222.title: A tall stone tower

14432221.content:
As you pulled on the door tirelessly, your sight was obscured by... golden blonde hair? But your hair wasn't...

You immediately jumped back and rushed to the vanity, seeing your hair, suddenly a shiny shade of golden blonde, growing in real-time, and growing until it went past your shoulders, past your back, past your feet, until your hair seemed to take up the entire room.

"This can't be..." you started.

You stepped back and tripped over your hair, landing down in it. This had to be a dream. You shut your eyes tightly and reopened them, disappointed to find yourself in the same spot with the same hair.

As you pulled yourself up, which was extremely hard given the new weight coming from your scalp, you grabbed a chair and sat in front of the vanity, taking in the appearance. Clearly this place was designed with the hair in mind, given all the brushes. Perhaps there was a way to better manage it? You didn't see anything bladed, so you settled for some decorated metal hair clips that you found in a drawer and started to brush the hair.

As you brush,
14432221.title: You notice long golden hair growing from your h...

choices: You take stock of your new body and changes
You hear the voice of an angry woman coming up the stairs
144322211.content:
Before you could react to your new hair it seemed your transformation had only just begun...

The first thing you noticed was your clothes were disappearing. They were actually disintegrating, turning to dust as your shirt, pants, shoes, and even underwear began to vanish as the dust blew away in the wind..

“What the heck is going on here!” You called now terrified and naked as tried to cut your blonde hair any way possible.

You even resorting to biting, tugging, and pulling, nothing seemed to work. It seemed the hair was enchanted in some way and you doubted even scissors would work at this point.

Unfortunately for you the changes had only just begun...Your body was now rapidly starting to change and reform itself into a much softer and feminine form.

All your body hair disappeared as the only hair on your body was the golden locks coming from your head.

Your body shrunk and thinned out as your masculine form was becoming more petite and feminine. Your muscles and masculinity faded with every second.

Your legs and feet shrunk and thinned out as sexy feminine muscle replaced your masculine ones. Your hips began to pop and widen out as your butt began to swell and grow. It filled with soft tissue reforming in shape and size turning into a perfect and sexy tear drop female behind.

Your stomach and abs tucked in as a flat and sexy tummy formed on your body. Your shoulders also narrowed and your ribcage shrunk your whole body twisting and turning into a new female frame.

Your face also began to shift as your cheekbones changed shape as your lips became plump, soft, and sexy. Your eyes also changed as your voice grew higher and softer with a very strangely melody in your voice. It was like your new voice was almost made for singing.

Your chest soon began to inflate and swell as new breasts grew on your chest. They quickly grew into As them Bs then Cs and finally resting on a nice full D cup. They were large but still perky and framed your body nicely.

Lastly your manhood slithered away disappearing inside you as new smooth and hairless slit took it place. The transformation was finally complete...

You sat there shaking from the change, laying in a make shift bed made of your own hair. When you finally were able to stand up and looked into the mirror you shrieked seeing a beautiful girl staring back at you!

You had changed into the version of Rapunzel from the story!
144322211.title: You undergo another transformation

choices: You're dragged back into the tower
You're approached by a figure on the ground
1443222111.content:
"This isn't..." you started. "I can't be..."

Before you could take full shock, you started to shiver. Even with the fireplace, you were freezing. You needed clothes. You walked over to the dresses hanging on the wall and stared at the dresses.

"I guess I have no other choices. It's either a dress, or stay naked and freeze." you remarked, and selected a purple dress.

You struggled to figure out how to put it on properly with your new form having trouble getting it to rest correctly on the chest and your newly lengthened fingernails didn't help. Once you managed to get it, and managed to get your hair into some semblance of order, you looked out the window. The rain had stopped.

Naturally the door was still locked, but you knew how Rapunzel worked. Her hair was indestructible, and the only way in or out of the castle was through the window.

"If the prince can climb up... why can't I climb down?" you reasoned out loud.

You walked over to the door and checked the handle.

"Sturdy." you smiled.

You quickly tied the end of your hair to the handle and knotted it for good measure. You grabbed an armful of hair and headed to the window. You weren't quite comfortable in this body, but given that the tower had transformed you, you wanted to get as far away as possible. You hopped up onto the ledge and started to scale down the tower.

After what felt like ages, you finally ran out of hair, just short of reaching the ground, and were left hanging. Thankfully, it didn't seem to hurt, however, you were humiliated, but thankful you decided to wear clothes before doing this.

After a while...
1443222111.title: You take stock of your new body and changes

14432221112.content:
You were now hanging in the wet rain by your hair dangling a few feet from the ground. If your hair wasn’t indestructible you could have cut yourself to freedom but sadly you were stuck there dangling...

As you sighed hanging there you suddenly began to hear something...Growling...It was low and sounded like a wild animal...

That’s when you saw it. A pair of glowing yellow eyes....

They grew bigger and bigger as a shadow emerged from the darkness. Emerging from it was the largest wolf you had ever seen...

You couldn’t even really call it a wolf it approached you on all fours but stood up on its hind legs standing over seven feet tall. His fur was jet black and his paws looked strangely like...hands...? He had the body of a wolf but the figure of...a man?

You didn’t know much about werewolves but you assumed this was one. It leaned in and began to sniff you with its large muzzle as it let out a blood curling Howl. Apparently it had no intention to harm you.

In fact it actually seemed to help you. It leaped up on the tower using its brute strength and agility to cling to the stone walls. Putting your hair in its mouth it actually began to pull you back up to the tower until you were inside again. Then with a single inhuman leap it leapt from the window and landed on the ground before disappearing into the darkness....

“You wanted to see your friend again? The Big Bad Wolf is your guardian child...Not your pet. I taught that pathetic human a life long lesson he will never forget.” The voice of an older woman said.

Spinning around you saw an old looking woman wearing a black coat carrying a basket of what seemed like was various food and drink.

“You will never learn child...Your gift is for me alone...The world would tear you apart if they knew it’s true power.” She said walking over to you.

Grabbing a handful of your hair she began to chant a strange sounding spell of sorts. It was like singing in an ancient language. As she did your hair actually began to glow lighting up the whole room and actually warming you as your wet body dried off instantly.

As she held your glowing hair her old age began to vanish as she returned to the age of a beautiful woman with long black hair but a cold and evil looking presence...

“Until next time my child...” She said giving you a small kiss on the forehead which creeped you out massively...

She turned and before you could even ask what was happening she opened the door which immediately slammed shut leaving you stuck here again...

You realized you were not just stuck in a traditional fairy tail...It was like this world itself was a fairy tale. Combing aspects of all sorts of legends into one.
14432221112.title: You're approached by a figure on the ground

choices: A man approaches the tower on horseback
144322211121.content:
"How did I even end up in this place?" you asked as you started to look around the room. "And why did I turn into Rapunzel?"

You were most attracted to the basket that the old woman had left behind, which was indeed filled with various types of foods and drinks. The time you spent handing by your hair made you quite hungry, but you were sure to not eat it all. After all, who knew when creepy lady was gonna come back?

Once your appetite was sated, you decided to give another shot to attempting to tame your mane of golden hair. There wasn't that much else to do, and you were definitely not trying another escape attempt for a while.

After a while, you started to get a handle on the brushing, since it was the only thing you could do there besides sleep. And that's how you spent the next... well, you didn't even know how long it had been since there was no clocks or any method to tell time. And with the stormy weather going in and out, you couldn't even watch the sun to check. For a good while, your existence was spent either brushing your hair, and slowly working it into a single, long braid, eating or sleeping. Not even the woman showed up, likely, she only came by when she needed to rejuvenate herself.

How long had you been there? Maybe hours, maybe days? Were people looking for you? Course, no one would recognize you if they found you. After what felt like ages:
144322211121.title: Alone in the tower

choices: The sound of a fight can be heard outside
1443222111212.content:
You lost track of time alone in that tower...You spent so much time alone you honestly forgot sometimes you were actually a guy trapped in this body and fairy tale world.

You saw the old woman return what seemed like around once a week. Every time she appeared she dropped off another basket and rejuvenated herself using your hair.

Every time you tried to speak out of turn or refused to help her it never ended well for you.

The first time you tried to overpower her but that was a horrible mistake. Despite her frail old body she had a strangely inhuman strength and overpowered you with one hand like it was nothing...

The next time you tried to run for it darting downstairs. However with a tug on your hair and her mighty strength you were pulled back with ease.

She also refused to answer any questions but every time you tried to escape you were punished for that week.

Her first punishment was the food she provided all became stale making your eating experience horrible for the week.

The next week your punishment was she took away the few time sink comforts you had away. Leaving you even more bored and alone then usual.

This last week she had enough with your escape attempts. You shouted and demanded she listen to your story but her patience had at its end.

“Enough! Maybe you learn now!” She said snapping her fingers.

The spell she cast suddenly made your clothes start to vanish and turn to dust on your body. Similar to the original spell that changed you before.

You tried to cover yourself using your hair and grab another dress only to have it turn to dust too.

“Maybe leaving you here naked, cold, and alone will teach you to behave...” She said slamming the door shut leaving you alone once more...

This punishment was the worst. The tower got cold at night so without any clothes you wrapped yourself up in hair and sat close to the fire trying to stay warm...

“How...how...could this get any worse.” You said tears falling from your face.
1443222111212.title: The old woman returns

14432221112121.content:
Despite your earlier run-in having been rather benign, you still had an instinctual reaction to be afraid. Maybe it was your newer, more vulnerable form, or just your utter despair from the punishment, but you were terrified as the howling got closer, and you heard the tell-tale skittering of claws climbing up the tower.

You quickly cowered in the corner as the wolf man climbed through the window and sniffed around the room.

"Stay away from me! Can't you see I've been punished enough today?" you shouted.

The wolf's head tilted, the way a dog does when a command is given, and he slowly approached you. You cried as he spread his arms and you thought you were about to be mauled to death.

"AHHHHHH!" you screamed as your voice was muffled by the fur.

What an end that would be! You get turned into a princess locked in a tower and die, naked and cold, torn to shreds by a wolf! Not the happily ever after you'd have expected.

Except, that's not what happened. What happened, was the wolf began to embrace you. He was acting like a living blanket, transferring his own warmth to you.

It felt so nice, and after all the exhaustion and punishments and cold temperatures in this un-insulated stone prison, you quickly fell into a deep slumber, curled up underneath your wolf friend.

As you slept:
14432221112121.title: You hear a howling outside

144322211121211.content:
For the first time since you arrived in the tower, you dreamed. But this one didn't feel like a dream, it felt like a memory...

You were standing in front of the mirror, wearing the purple dress that you really liked. It was your favorite. Your hair was neatly and expertly braided into a single, long braid, done with hands that had been doing it all their life. You noticed that you seemed younger, somehow. While you had been in your mid-twenties when you got lost in the forest, you looked to be closer to being a teenager now. As you beamed at the mirror, you heard an excited voice approaching.

"Rapunzel! Rapunzel! Let down your hair!" the voice shouted.

You rushed to the window, your heart racing. It was him! Frederick, a young man who had stumbled upon the tower a few months prior, and always came to visit. You had exchanged small gifts with him, mainly trinkets that you kept in a secret, hidden spot in your vanity, and you always lifted him by your hair, into the room. He was also unable to open the door, but at least you had company. And over the months, you had grown to love him, after all, he was only the second person you'd ever met!

Unfortunately, the two of you had made a crucial mistake. On this day, as he was about to depart, giving you his customary, chivalric kiss on the cheek, and his daily promise to one day free you from the tower, the door burst open. The old woman!

"You thought you could enlist the help of this boy to help you escape? Don't you know that he only wants you for your hair's power?" the woman asked.

"You're wrong, I love her, and I want her to be free!" Frederick shouted, stepping in front of you.

"How heroic..." the old woman sneered. "If you want to protect her so much, so be it!"

The woman stretched her fingers out and lightning seemed to shoot out towards Frederick. He doubled over in pain as hair began to grow on his body, and he began transforming into a wolf! As your love's face contorted and grew furry, you recoiled in horror.

"NOOOO!" you screamed as the dream ended.
144322211121211.title: An insightful dream

1443222111212111.content:
You woke up in the comfort of Fredricks warm and furry arms. His massive body as a werewolf was more than enough to cover you. His muzzle snuggled against your soft face as his long tail wagged as he slept.

As you awoke still naked due to your recent punishment you looked out to the meadow as the sun shined brightly outside.

The old witches curse kept Fredrick in his wolf form forever. Cursed to be your protector for all time. As he awoke he let out a loud wolf like yawn.

You looked to yourself and then back to him. The dreams...the memories...were they yours? Or were they just part of this curse to begin with. Either way you had enough of being trapped here...

“Fredrick...we are leaving!” You said with a sudden stout confidence in yourself.

Fredrick’s ears perked up as you looked to you like a confused dog.

“You have to protect me right? You can’t let any harm come to me? That’s your curse?” You asked.

Fredrick looked a bit confused as he nodded slowly wondering where you were going with this.

“Then I have a plan...” You said with a smile. Curse or no curse you would rather be naked forever then spend one more day in this damn tower.

You began to braid your hair. The time you had spent here making you an expert by now. Once your hair was put into a single long braid, it was still the length of your body, but now more manageable.
